title: Specialist Mining Engineer (Contract)
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Building and Construction, Engineering, Professional Services, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job posting for Singapore location

#hiring
#singaporejobs
#singaporeans
#Projectmanager



Company Overview
Our client is a n European company specialized in testing, inspection and certification founded in 1828. It operates in a variety of sectors, including building and infrastructure (27% of revenue), agri-food and commodities (23% of revenue), marine and offshore (7% of revenue), industry (22% of revenue), certification (7% of revenue) and consumer products (14% of revenue).
It is present in 140 countries through a network of over 1,500 offices and laboratories, and 84,000 employees. It generated €5.65 billion in revenue in 2022.

Job highlight
Ø Working opportunity with a well-known & established European company
Ø Job status: Project based Contract job| 5.5-days’ work week
Ø Bugis location
Ø High Salary | Nearby MRT station

Responsibilities
· To review (with calculations) the Contractor’s design, supervise and co-ordinate all aspects for the mining works.
· To ensure that the construction is carried out in accordance with the design, all relevant standards, contract specifications, approved method
· To prepare and develop detailed supervision schedule and comprehensive checklist for the conduct of the inspection and excavation construction activities associated with the micro-tunneling and mining works. This shall include at critical interfaces with adjacent important structures such as MRT and Tunnel, Road Flyover and Canal.
· To review construction drawings, method statements and construction sequence for all aspects of the temporary and permanent works of the micro-tunneling and mining works. Their interface with the cut-and-cover tunnels, modification proposals to the design and construction methods.
· To follow-up and supervise all modification at every stage of the mining construction including excavation, concreting, installation of support/stabilizing elements, casting of concrete and all other works to achieve the full completion of the tunnel in a safe manner.
· To conduct daily review meeting on site with the civil contractors, Qualified Person and Geotechnical Instrumentation and Monitoring contractor. He shall ensure that geotechnical and tunneling data are synchronized for optimal and safe tunneling
· To prepare reports to preserve the knowledge and experience gained from the project, addressing all aspects of the micro-tunneling and future improvements.

Requirement
· Degree in Civil Engineering or Building Construction
· Relevant technical certifications will be advantageous
· 10 years of relevant experience in supervising mining and micro tunnelling works in the civil projects
· Expertise in the management ofthe overall Project schedule
· Skill in Handlingdisputes or differences that may arise between the Company and the EPC Contractors or other parties in association with the Project and assist in settling them.
· Proven skills in maintainingand providing records and documentation for the Project and handover the consolidated document and as-built drawings (as approved by the relevant Government Agency(ies)) to the Company upon completion of the Project
· Time management and organization skill
· Excellent communication skill in English and local languages (Chinese, Mandarin, Bahasa Melayu, Tamil, etc.) to communicate with the stakeholders and vendors easily.
· Negotiation skills | Risk analysis skill| High level of business acumen
· Possess good attitude, Proactive
· Project Management skill will be advantageous
· Able to work independently.

Project Schedule / Work Details
· Nature of Project: Buildings & Infrastructure
· Starting date & duration: Will be advised on later date
· Working location: Bugis area
· Working days: 5.5 days’ work week
· Working hours: 8.30am – 5.30pm (will be confirmed on later date)
· Annual, Medical Leave, Insurances, Employer CPF, etc will be covered.

Salary & Benefits
· Monthly basic salary: SGD $7k-8K
· Annual: 12 days
· Medical Leave: 14 days
· Medical Insurances, Employer CPF, etc. will be covered.

NB: No quotas for the foreigners please. Singaporeans /SPRs only due to quota issue.
Please send your updated CV in MSWORD at leeza.shaheed@venture-cove.com, recruitment@venture-cove.com,mentioning your expected and latest drawn monthly basic salary, notice period and reason for looking for a new job opportunity.

Please contact our Consultant Leeza Shaheed (R1770675) for further enquiries about the roles @ leeza.shaheed@venture-cove.com.

(EA License 21C0547)

Website: http://www.venture-cove.com/

title: Senior Project Manager (1 year contract / SD-Wan Delivery)
company_info: AEA INTERNATIONAL HOLDINGS PTE. LTD.
address: ESR BIZPARK @ CHANGI, 8 CHANGI BUSINESS PARK AVENUE 1 486018
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A. Overall Purpose Of The Job

The Senior Project Manager is part of the PMO team and is responsible for planning, overseeing and leading projects from ideation through to completion. This role at International SOS requires specializing in SD-WAN delivery where you will be responsible for planning, contracting, coordinating the technical design and documentation and managing the end-to-end execution of a landmark transformation project. You will collaborate with IT solution vendors, partners, cross-functional teams, including stakeholders from various business line, to ensure successful project delivery aligned with business requirements. Your expertise in project management and technical leadership will be vital in driving the successful implementation of complex infrastructure projects.


B. Key Responsibilities

· As the Senior Project Manager, manage core program deliverables on time and within budget while mitigating issues and risks to achieve the business benefit of the program.
· Contribute and shape the statement of work to achieve RFP objectives and business as well as operational requirements.
· Drive vendors to meet their commitments per agreed work order or statement of work
· Tailor and provide the right program and project communication updates to all necessary stakeholders
· Define the customisation of global operational processes together with relevant point of contacts to meet project requirements acceptance
· Manage relationships of all stakeholders and resources during delivery and serve as a primary interface between the various internal and external points of contact
· Manage all complaints, change requirements and corrective actions, while avoiding “scope creep”
· Prepare a clear and effective communications plan, and ensure proactive communication of all relevant information to all stakeholders
· Monitor and control so that the project streams within the program are delivered within the approved budget, forecast, and planned scope.
· Ensure that the project meets all objectives for quality and looks continuously for quality improvement and customer satisfaction.
· Actively apply appropriate best practices and lessons learned throughout the life of the project. Monitor, control and report KPIs defined in customer contract.
· Ensure data in all project-related tools and repositories is accurate and up-to-date
· Conduct thorough risk management for all project risks and opportunities
· Lead the project team to execute against the project objectives
· Complete the project closure and handover as required, and include: complete contractual requirements, post calculation and, lessons learned
· Drive and close out any operational issues that arise during project delivery phases until handover completed and accepted by run teams.
· Maintain all project artifacts, including infrastructure diagrams, technical specifications, and configurations.
· Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to team members.
· Foster a collaborative and positive team environment, promoting effective communication and problem-solving across infrastructure projects.


C. Job Profile

· Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
· Proven experience as a Senior Project Manager, or similar combined roles, managing enterprise-wide, complex SD-WAN projects.
· Strong knowledge of IT Infrastructure principles, network architecture, server infrastructure, storage systems, and security mechanisms.
· Well versed on IT Service Management processes such as incident, change, problem management.
· Familiarity with cloud platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or GCP, and infrastructure automation tools.
· Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to understand complex business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
· Strong project management skills, including the ability to develop and maintain project plans, monitor progress, and manage budgets and resources.
· Effective communication and interpersonal skills to manage senior stakeholders and collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
· Strong leadership skills to provide technical guidance and mentorship to team members.
· Relevant certifications, such as CISA, CCNA, CompTIA Network+, or ITIL, are a plus.

title: Photography Studio - Photo Editor (Internship / Contract)
company_info: Ashley Low Photography is a family photography studio specialising in Newborn & Baby photography since 2011. Founded by Ashley Low, Ashley has since captured photos of more than 3000 children of all ages. In 2016, she was awarded the title of “Master Photographer” by Master Photographer’s Association in U.K, and has won multiple international newborn photography awards. She has also been named as “One of the Newborn Photographers in Singapore you can trust” and “One of the best family photographers in Singapore” by various publications. As a company, she has grown from 1 woman's show to now a team of 5. In addition, we now have a sister company called "Bloom Photography", which exist to provide our services to a different target market. Our vision is to bring families closer to build togetherness, internally and externally.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
If you are interested to perfect a nice portrait and be in the photography field, we want you!

As a Assistant Photo Editor, the candidate will assist us in:
Looking through all our galleries (of photos of babies, families, pets) and sieve through the best to present to our customers.
Perfect our photos by retouching on portraits of adults, babies and newborns.
The Assistant will be learning the following skills from us:
How best to cull (shortlist) the galleries of hundreds of photos.
How to use softwares like Adobe Bridge / Lightroom to adjust thousands of photos and galleries of shoots.
Skin retouching skills, such as smoother skin, slimming, etc.
Adjust files suitable for printers (of canvases, albums and other products)
Other than working on our galleries of photos, the person will also be assisting us in preparing the files to send out for customers, and other minor stuff like sorting out our server.

Requirements:
Know how to use very basic Lightroom or Bridge software
Know basic understanding of lighting, composition.
Have interest in the world of editing and/or photography
Able to work independently as well as a team.
Suitable for internships, part-timers (who wants to negotiate time/day), etc.

If you are interested, please send an CV with a short introduction of yourself and links to any works you might have done before. A short introduction will help me understand you better.

title: Equipment Assembly Specialist (1 year contract - renewable)
company: VDL ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES GROUP (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
company_info: VDL ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES GROUP (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. is a subsidiary of the VDL Group, an international industrial company with its headquarters in Eindhoven, The Netherlands. The company started its operations in 1970 as a manufacturer of machine parts used in factory automation and assemblies for its then-parent company. Over the years, we haveaccumulated valued competencies that has enabled us to grow as an equipment manufacturer. Today, we are a world-class capital equipment contract manufacturing company operating worldwide, employing committed people to provide our customers in the semiconductor and LED equipment industries with innovative and unique technological solutions and logistical services. With our rapid expansion and new facility, we seek dynamic and like-minded individuals to join us. Advance the world of engineering possibilities, realize your potential and succeed with us here at VDL Enabling Technologies Group.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Purpose: The role will be responsible for performing equipment assembly according to assembly drawings that are able to meet customers' requirements and specifications.

Key Area of Responsibilities:

· Perform basic & advanced machine electrical wiring works.
· Assemble electrical or electronic systems or support structures and install components, units, subassemblies, wiring, or assembly.
· Perform assembly per assembly drawing, Bill of Material, Electrical and Pneumatic control diagram.
· Perform alignment, test, process inspection, integration, and product release procedures.
· Inspect wiring installations, assemblies, and circuits.
· Perform reporting in shop floor control system
· To ensure quality, efficiency, and delivery performance.
· Perform periodical calibration and maintenance for assembly tools.
· Handling quality and shipment documents.
· Participate in programs for improvement.
· Practice work safety and good 5S housekeeping.

Qualification & Experiences:

· Nitec/Higher Nitec/Diploma in Mechanical Engineering/Electrical Engineering/Mechatronic Engineering or equivalent course
· Fresh graduates are welcome
· Preferably with Workplace safety & health in Metal work certification
· Knowledge on assembly drawing.

(Note: must be able to commit to 12-hour shift work)

job_category: Building and Construction, Consulting, Engineering, Manufacturing
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Contract Manager/Quantity Surveyor holds a vital role in our construction projects, overseeing contract administration, cost management, and procurement processes. This position combines meticulous attention to detail, strong industry knowledge, and effective communication skills to interact with various stakeholders. The Contract Manager/Quantity Surveyor's primary location is in the office, with occasional site visits as project requirements dictate.

Contract Administration and Workflow Management:
Administer project contracts and oversee workflows including variations and Contractor’s claim processes.
Ensure timely issuance of contractual notices as per project contract requirements.
Contractual Advice and Payment Management:
Advise management on contractual matters, progress payments, variation and cost claims with contractor and client.
Review and assess variation order requests, proposals, and associated costs.
Provide guidance to Project Manager/Director on cost impact due to project specification variations.
Prepare final accounts for settlement with contractors.
Cost Management and Analysis:
Evaluate completed works, comparing them with budget allocations.
Monitor actual costs versus project budget, identifying discrepancies and proposing corrective actions.
Pre and Post Contracts:
Assist in preparing, negotiating, and administering pre and post-contracts.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities

This is a 12 months contract assigned to our client

Work Location: To be confirmed
Salary Range : $7,000-$9,500


Job Scope
As an AWS Infrastructure Lead, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing project's cloud infrastructure on Amazon Web Services (AWS) in Government Commercial Cloud 2.0 (GCC 2.0). You will play a critical role in ensuring the reliability, scalability, and security of our cloud-based systems. This position requires a strong technical background in AWS and infrastructure management, as well as leadership skills to guide a team of junior engineers.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Infrastructure Design and Architecture:
a. Collaborate closely with the client's Infrastructure team to facilitate discussions and develop a comprehensive AWS infrastructure design that aligns with the project's requirements.
b. Develop and maintain the overall AWS infrastructure architecture, ensuring it aligns with business goals and scalability requirements.
c. Collaborate with junior engineers to build, test and implement cloud solutions that meet the project’s needs.

2. AWS Resource Management:
a. Manage and optimize AWS resources, including EC2 instances, S3 storage, RDS databases, and other services.
b. Implement cost-effective strategies to monitor and control AWS usage and expenses.

3. Security and Compliance:
a. Ensure the security and compliance of AWS environments, including configuring security groups, IAM policies, and encryption mechanisms.
b. Implement best practices for data protection and access control.

4. High Availability and Disaster Recovery:
a. Design and implement high availability and disaster recovery solutions to minimize downtime and data loss.
b. Create and test backup and recovery plans.

5. Automation and Infrastructure as Code (IaC):
a. Develop and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) scripts and templates using tools like Terraform.
b. Automate deployment and scaling processes.

6. Performance Optimization:
a. Monitor system performance and identify opportunities for optimization and performance tuning.
b. Implement scaling strategies to accommodate growing workloads.

7. Team Leadership:
a. Lead a team of junior engineers, providing guidance, mentorship, and support.
b. Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture.

8. Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:
a. Maintain detailed documentation of AWS configurations, procedures, and best practices.
b. Share knowledge and provide training to team members and stakeholders.

Certifications
1. AWS certifications, such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, or AWS Certified SysOps Administrator.
2. Proven experience in AWS infrastructure management, including designing, deploying, and optimizing AWS environments.
3. Strong understanding of cloud security, compliance, and best practices.
4. Proficiency in infrastructure as code (IaC) tools and automation.
5. Leadership and team management experience.
6. Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
7. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
8. Flexibility to participate in on-call rotations and handle urgent infrastructure issues.
9. Keeping up-to-date with AWS services and industry trends.
10. Proven experience in Government Commercial Cloud (GCC) is a plus

Educational Qualification :
1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
2. Master's degree preferred
This is a 12 months contract assigned to our client

Actively seeking out new global banking solutions to enhance banking systems and processes.
Designing and configuring the global Bank Account Management (BAM) system, including the creation and documentation of workflows for BAM, onboarding the new system, and deploying it to all 220 legal entities.
Developing, monitoring, and regularly updating a Fraud Awareness e-Learning module available in multiple languages.
Creating and configuring bank-agnostic Payment Formats (XML 20022) and offering technical guidance for various ISO 20022 format projects. This may involve creating XML payment formats from SAP and collaborating with global HR partners.
Handling the technical design and configuration of the global SWIFT-connected platform, FIS 'TRAX,' in collaboration with P2P Business Process Analysts from 'Global Finance Ops' and global HR partners. This includes creating and documenting payment workflow processes through TRAX to SWIFTnet.
Collaborating with SAP rollout projects led by the 'Global Finance Operations' Business Process Analyst (BPA) group.
Serving as a Business Process Analyst for 'Global Finance Operations' in Banking and Treasury, responsible for designing, creating, and driving solutions for Global Finance Ops.
Sourcing and managing regional revaluation and daily transaction FX rates used in the ERP system SAP.
Sourcing and managing industry-leading market data and trading platforms for Group Treasury, providing FX market data for both Group Treasury and the 220 legal entities.
Handling the technical design configuration of the Treasury Management System (TMS) 'KTP.'
Managing the technical design and maintenance of the Treasury site on Microsoft SharePoint, designed to disseminate data and information to all 220 legal entities.
Establishing SWIFT connectivity for approximately 550 bank accounts worldwide through the global bank platform FIS 'TRAX.'
Maintaining and enhancing auditable system-based controls as per the design established by the UMG Treasury Controller.
Designing and maintaining Treasury system 'Process & Control Procedures' to support UMG Treasury Policies.
The Successful Applicant
At least 2 year of treasury operations experience in an MNC environment.
Possesses robust analytical abilities coupled with a proactive and discerning approach, enabling the design of comprehensive end-to-end solutions tailored to banking requirements.
Demonstrates the capacity to work independently, meeting deadlines for assigned tasks or projects in a fast-paced environment
Familiarity with XML bank file structures and SWIFT-based workflows.
Proficiency in SAP, FIS TRAX, TIS BAM, and TMS systems.
What's on Offer
Excellent opportunity to join a global European MNC.
Regional exposure to work with teams globally.
Individual contributor role. Opportunity to set up the treasury team in APAC
Hybrid working arrangements.
6 months contract with potential for extension and conversion.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Lab Technician (Quality Control/ QMS/ Contract/ Entry Level)

12-Month Contract (Convertible to Perm)
Location : Jurong Refinery
Company Transport Provided
Industry : Oil & Gas

Our client is one of the world's largest publicly traded international oil and gas companies . They are actively looking for Lab Technician to join their operations.

Main Responsibilities :
Contribute to the safe operation and quality of the Lab to meet the Business Team Goals.
Intervene when observing unsafe act and identify safety issues within the Lab and raise to the appropriate level.
Strengthen and maintain the creditability of Lab testing skill.
Respond to emergencies

Responsibilities :
Understands the requirements of and executes work in his assigned post in accordance with the Lab Quality, Operating and Safety Procedures and comply to QP&G, ASTM/IP/UOP/AMS/AMI/IH’s Testing Methods, Site Safety Standards and OIMS requirements.
Understand and apply LPS requirements as defined in OIMS 5.1 including LPSA in daily tasks participate in LPO process, JLA development and Near Miss Reporting.
Responsible for his/her own safety and the safety of others (Actively Caring) in assigned post. Participates in safety audits and take action to rectify unsafe facilities, work conditions and acts.
Participates in safety meetings and periodically conducts field checks on work in respective areas.
Participates in incident investigations and proposes solutions and recommendations to prevent recurrence.
Participates in emergency drills and able to react confidently when BCP activated.
Ownership and ensure of housekeeping standards are met in their assigned area.
Able to recognize and understand the GHS requirement and hazards controls and identifications.
Must know all the locations of fire extinguishers / Emergency Eye Wash / Emergency Showers / Safety Critical Devices and Control of Defeats procedures and Posion Withdrawal Rule and Regulation and use them effectively.
Execute work in his assigned post accordance with the DIAF, Control of QP&G, ISO 17025, Lab Quality Manual, Lab Operating Procedures, and ASTM/IP/UOP/AMS/AMI/IH Testing Methods.
Understand and conduct responsibilities as defined in OIMS 6.2 .
Conduct routine and certifying of refinery products as per testing methods.
Perform Lab instrument’s SQC as per schedules.
Conduct V&V and intervention on peer and contractors working within Lab to ensure safe work practices are adhered to.

Requirements:
Polytechnic graduate with the background in Chemical/Process/Technical Engineering. Computer-literate.
Experience in quality control systems will be ideal

Requirements gathering;
Design, development, and maintenance of the software;

Assist the Authority with day-to-day application support issues; and
Liaise with users on the requirement, design and testing issues

Tertiary qualification in Electrical/ Electronics/ Mechanical Engineering/ Computer Science or a relevant discipline
At least 3 years in software development and system integration

➢ Java application development
➢ Web application using HTML/HTML5, JavaScript and JavaScript Framework (i.e. AngularJS, ExtJS, JQuery,Bootstrap)

Cloud (e.g. AWS)

➢ Single Sign-on solutions (e.g. OAuth, OpenID Connect,SAML)

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Resourceful and self-motivated team player
Good written and verbal communication skills in English

title: Associate / AVP, Identity Access Management (1 Year Contract), Technology Group
company_info: With over US$100 billion in investments across 40 countries, we are among the world's largest fund management companies. Established in 1981 to manage Singapore's foreign reserves, we strive to achieve good long-term real returns on assets under our management to preserve and enhance Singapore's reserves. Our investment framework capitalises on our strengths, such as the ability to take a long-term investment perspective, a global presence, capabilities to invest in cross-asset opportunities, with skilled and experienced teams. We are headquartered in Singapore with a network of ten offices in key financial cities worldwide.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
GIC is one of the world’s largest sovereign wealth funds. With over 2,000 employees across 11 offices around the world, we invest in more than 40 countries globally across asset classes and businesses. Working at GIC gives you exposure to an extraordinary network of the world’s industry leaders. As a leading global long-term investor, we Work at the Point of Impact for Singapore’s financial future, and the communities we invest in worldwide.

Technology Group
We experiment, design, and lead a 24×7 global business where we support core capabilities in asset management, trading, investment operations, and risk management. We deliver secure, reliable, and integrated solutions, and provide insights on new, and emerging technologies. We are looking for a suitable candidate for the role of Specialist, Identity and Access Management (Contract). This role drive governance controls, reporting, monitoring, and processes around identity lifecycle management, access management and access recertification.

Cyber Security, Information & Technology Risk Management
You will be a part of an independent risk management function to protect the firm’s information technology assets, including business data, from external threats and operational risks, and to facilitate the firm’s digitalisation journey in a secure manner.

What Impact can you make in this role?
The IAM Specialist drives governance controls, reporting, monitoring, and processes around identity lifecycle management, access management and access recertification. He/she is expected to perform the following duties:

Responsibilities
Collaborate and monitor the activities of a variety of IAM-related projects and initiatives.
Document and communicate IAM services, capabilities, policies and procedures to key IAM stakeholders
Attend to IAM related queries from relevant stakeholders.
Coordinate and front internal and external IT audits on IAM related areas.
Manage lifecycle of enterprise identities.
Manage access provisioning/de-provisioning and review due to staff movements.
Perform review of access roles based on IAM framework and standards as part of IT risk assessment for IT asset and projects.
Track and manage Segregation of Duties and other IAM compliance related activities.
Identify process automation opportunities to support IAM innovation.
Respond to IAM related security incidents.
Requirements
Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or in other related field of study.
Minimum 5 years of Cyber Security experience with at least 3 years in Identity and Access Management.
CISSP, CIAM or similar professional certifications will be advantageous.
Must understand or have knowledge of “Least Privileged” access management methodology
Knowledge and exposure in the following areas are essentialMicrosoft Active Directory, database and UNIX
Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure
Privileged access management
Ability to develop SQL scripts to retrieve data for BAU work.
Ability to effectively communicate with technical and executive audiences, both oral and written is required.
Experience in financial services industry is preferred
Work at the Point of Impact
We need to be forward-looking to attract the right people to help us become the Leading Global Long-term Investor. Join our ambitious, agile, and diverse teams - be empowered to push boundaries and pursue innovative ideas, share your views, and be heard. Be anchored on our PRIME Values: Prudence, Respect, Integrity, Merit and Excellence, which guides us in how we make our day-to-day decisions. We strive to inspire. To make an impact.

Flexibility at GIC
At GIC, our offices are vibrant hubs for ideation, professional growth, and interpersonal connection. At the same time, we believe that flexibility allows us to do our best work and be our best selves. Thus, our teams come into the office four days per week to harness the benefits of in-person collaboration, but have the flexibility to choose which days they work from home and adjust this arrangement as situational needs arise.

GIC is an equal opportunity employer
GIC is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please email grphrodtaops@gic.com.sg at any point of the application or interview process if adjustments need to be made due to a disability.

For your application to be considered, please apply directly at our career page : https://careers.gic.com.sg/job-invite/15455/

Roles & Responsibilities
Department/Job Overview:
This is a Product Control ENO/ AVP role in Singapore covering for APAC Investment Banking Capital Markets (IBCM) business area. The main responsibility of this role is to validate fee P&L of the IBCM deals, including M&A transactions, IPO and follow-ons and Debt issuance, to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of books and records and provide commentary on P&L and balance sheet movements for reporting.

Key Responsibilities:
The role will also be involved in the following responsibilities below:
Revenue recognition of the deals adhere to accounting standards
Understanding any off-balance sheet commitment such as hard or sub-underwriting
Ensuring the underwriting reserves are reported correctly
Taking into account of any FX implications
Revenue split considerations on IPO, rights or any inter-regional transfer
Generating entity and country reporting
Knowledge of various markets conventions and tax legislations
Support and facilitate fee structure, economics and settlement (billing and delivery)
Support book closure and business re-organization
Qualifications:
Degree in Finance or Accountancy preferred
Exposure to basic vanilla financial products
Strong Excel skills
Strong process skills, including understanding of deal capture, settlement, accounting and reporting processes

title: Executive, Finance (Contract - 3 months)
company_info: Singapore Swimming Club started when a small group of young swimming enthusiasts got together at the end of 1893 to start a swimming club. Little did they know that they were laying the foundations for a premier club of the twenty-first century. The Club started operating out of a dilapidated hut by a sandbar in 1894. That hut was later abandoned when a more suitable clubhouse was found – a bungalow with a beach front. The site on which that bungalow stood was to become the site on which our present Club stands today. Over the years, the Club overcame the social and political changes prevalent at the various points in its history. Internally, there was the issue for equality, first for European women, later for Asians. Politically, changes in the Club’s constitution had to be made as Singapore transformed from a British colony to a self-governing state. The physical environment had also undergone sweeping changes. In its early days, the Club was situated in an idyllic beachfront. By 1930s, the Tanjong Rhu area was turning into an industrial area and the shipyards were polluting the sea. In the 70s and 80s, the government decided to turn the area into a residential area. The shipyards, sawmills and flour mills moved out progressively. Then with land reclamation, the Club lost its seafront but gained 96,436 square feet of reclaimed land to expand the Club. After nearly a century of ground shifting, the Club found itself settled on 3 hectares of freehold land nestled between luxurious condominium blocks in an exclusive residential district, just 6 km from the city centre and a 15-minute drive from Changi International Airport. The renovated Administration Building of the Singapore Swimming Club was officially opened on 27 February 2001 by the then President of Singapore, Mr S R Nathan. On 14 April 2002, the foundation for a modern mega club was built when the relevant authorities approved the renewal of lease where the Sports Centre is situated, paving the way for the next phase of development: a state-of-the-art sporting facility. Today, Singapore Swimming Club stands as a premier club, owned and run by members. The membership profile today is cosmopolitan, reflecting where we are at in the country’s social and political and economic history. Over the years, the Club has nurtured the qualities of care and concern and has positioned itself as a “Family Club”. These have been incorporated into its wide milieu of sporting and social activities.
description:

company_info: About NTUC Club @ Downtown East Established in 1986 as the entertainment and leisure arm of the National Trades Union Congress (NTUC), NTUC Club is committed to the social mission of providing affordable recreational experiences of choice for our members and the public. We also support the Labour Movement and aim to build a more inclusive society in Singapore. This means taking a social responsibility towards our staff, the community, and the environment, which is core to everything NTUC Club does. Brands and Entities Our key properties include Downtown East, a lifestyle destination which provides exciting activities and fun facilities for members of the Labour Movement and public alike under one roof. With the completion of the five-year Refreshing Downtown East redevelopment project in 2018, Downtown East now includes the nature-inspired D’Resort, an expanded water park Wild Wild Wet, a myriad of retail dining and entertainment options at Market Square – E!Avenue and E!Hub, and union engagement amenities MUCE (Membership & Union Community Engagement). Other brands under NTUC Club include Aranda Country Club, Orchid Country Club, Marina Bay Golf Course, Quebec Leisure as well as clubhouses such as Scarlet City, Happy Days, Jest D’Place and Union Square. NTUC Club also engages members of the Labour Movement at their various life stages – nEbO, the junior membership arm of NTUC for youths aged 12 to 25; U Live, the community for active agers aged 55 and above; and U Sports, for sports enthusiasts. Social Commitment NTUC Club's Family Fun Fiesta (F3) is one of the ways we fulfil our social purpose to ensure no one is excluded from enjoying quality recreational experiences. Held several times a year, F3 provides lower-income NTUC members and their families with complimentary experiential fun at our facilities. In addition, we also give back to the community by volunteering and working with various beneficiaries. Our staff visited beneficiaries such as Willing Hearts and Singapore Food Bank, to help prepare meals. Together with the Attractions, Resorts & Entertainment Union (AREU), our staff sewed stuffed toys made from socks, with proceeds going to Dignity Mama to enable young adults with disabilities to gain basic entrepreneurial skills and lead independent lives. If you aspire to be part of the Labour Movement, and believe in our social mission, find out more at: www.ntucclub.com/career.

title: Assistant Director (HR Business Partner) - Contract
company_info: At CPF Board, we’re more than just a retirement savings scheme – we’re at the heart of Singapore’s social security system, impacting the lives of more than 4 million members. As one of the top 10 pension funds globally, we provide financial security for Singaporeans in their retirement years, giving them the peace of mind to enjoy their golden years. But that's not all - we also provide insurance coverage in the event of death or disability, help Singaporeans become homeowners, and provide universal healthcare insurance, which help citizens cope with life's uncertainties. With the ability to touch 4 million lives, we are the go-to agency for citizen disbursements, and disbursed $4.1 billion in government benefits to Singaporeans in 2022. We are a unique social security system and trusted partner to Singaporeans in achieving their life goals.
address: TOWER B NOVENA SQUARE, 238B THOMSON ROAD 307685
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What the role is
As a member of Team Central Provident Fund (CPF), you will play a crucial role in helping over 4 million members save for their retirement, healthcare, and housing needs as well as helping them cope with life’s uncertainties. With a fulfilling career, career growth, and development opportunities, you will be part of a big family of dedicated professionals. Join us and champion financial security for Singaporeans while leaving a lasting legacy.

What you will be working on
As a HR Business Partner, you will advise and support your business leaders/line managers/workforce in the full spectrum of HR operations, including onboarding, performance management, talent management, disciplinary matters, exit management and employee communications to achieve effective business outcomes. This involves translating business strategy into aligned HR action plan for successful execution within the organisation. You are expected to be seen as a trusted advisor to strategic partners.

Key Responsibilities
• Partner business stakeholders through a proactive and consultative approach in various strategic HR areas (onboarding, development, engagement, retention, disability inclusion), and work with HR counterparts on the implementation of solutions and employee communication
• Support officers through the employee life cycle from onboarding, deployment, development and off-boarding, and to provide professional advice on HR policies, initiatives and processes as well as employee well-being support
• Establish strong partnership and engagement with core management team to develop HR strategies that support achieving organisational goals, as well as to improve work relationships and build morale to improve productivity and retention of officers
• Manage specific projects as determined in the annual business and HR strategic plan (e.g.: strategic workforce planning), and contribute to functional and cross-functional initiatives
• Apply frameworks, tools and techniques to diagnose issues and co-develop solutions that ensure buy-in from senior leaders and other stakeholders (including sharing relevant practices in the market and data analytics/insights)
• Be an effective people catalyst between the business and HR, and forged trusted partnerships via the development and communication of organisation’s strategies and policies to officers with a proper feedback channel

What we are looking for
• At least 5 years of relevant experience in a large organization, preferably with a post-graduate Diploma in Human Resource Management / iHRP certification
• Strong business acumen, critical thinking and data analytical experience which will be vital in the review of initiatives, processes and procedures
• Good communication, writing and interpersonal skills
• Ability to manage diversity, work well with cross-functional teams in a high-pressured and fast-paced environment
• Resourceful and resilient
• Effective team player and independent worker

job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Banking and Finance
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Principal Auditor leads or works independently on audits of a specific business / functional area / region, and evaluates the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls relating to risks within those business areas.
They will proactively develop and maintains professional consultative working relationships within their own function and with stakeholders inside and outside the bank and respective support areas.
They will use a range of approaches to collect relevant information to assess key risks, resolve major issues or carry out tasks.
The Principal Auditor works in a co-operative manner with subject matter experts and other teams from across the function and outside the function to provide ‘front-to-back’ audit coverage and actively contribute to the delivery of team plans in support of the functional and business strategies, working under limited supervision. They may occasionally participate in ad-hoc projects and special investigations.

Responsibilities:
Reporting to a Principal Audit Manager, the Principal Auditor will work as part of a multi-disciplinary audit team within Singapore. Whilst the work will predominantly focus on auditing the Investment Bank Origination & Advisory Division (Corporate Finance) there will also be the need to cover other areas of the bank from time to time. Based in Singapore, the role will allow for limited travel to other locations, mainly within Asia Pacific.
Execute day-to-day operational audit work and contribute to the delivery of audits (including the Continuous Monitoring process and the updating of Risk Assessment Profiles).
Undertake audit assignments, draft audit findings / reports for review by audit management, facilitate issue tracking and validate closure of issue.
Lead and / or execute audit work in line with the agreed audit approach e.g. documenting Activity / Process Flows, identification of key risks and testing of key controls to determine whether they are properly designed and are operating effectively and documenting work in accordance with Group Audit (GA) standards.
Complete all assigned work in line with agreed budgets, including ad hoc projects and special investigations.
Proactively develop and maintain professional working relationships with colleagues, the business and respective support areas.
Partner with other audit teams (regionally and / or globally) such as Risk, Finance, Technology and Operations during audit engagements to ensure comprehensive coverage and an integrated approach to front to back audits of Investment Bank Origination & Advisory and its associated support functions.
Communicate openly with GA management and the internal stakeholders; keep them informed of potential issues and escalate problems / delays accordingly.
Keep abreast of pertinent industry, regulatory and business practices.
Deliver and sustain own performance against key objectives in the context of functional strategies.
Support the development of an environment where people management and development is the number one priority.
Take ownership for own career management, seek opportunities for continuous development of personal capability and improve performance contribution.
Requirements:
Knowledge and experience of financial services particularly Investment Banking products including interest rate, foreign exchange, equity, and structured products, coupled with familiarisation of working within the operational requirements and regulatory environment of a global Bank.
Professional credentials, including degree level education and a relevant professional qualification.
Knowledge of auditing standards and concepts.
Fluency in English and Chinese (written and verbal) languages as this role requires liaising with local, regional and global stakeholders.
A proven track record of meeting client needs in a financial services environment.
Excellent team working capabilities and an ability to build strong business and team relationships.
Strong strategic / analytical thinking.
Strong project management and planning skills.
Able to convey, complex concepts and ideas on issues requiring interpretation and opinion, in a logical and structured approach.
Able to challenge and be challenged whilst maintaining the highest levels of professionalism.
Experienced in delivering work under tight deadlines.

title: Specialist (Learning & Special Needs) - 1 Year Contract
company_info: RecruiterPal is a cloud-based recruitment platform that helps you to recruit staff faster and easier, giving you full control and overview of your entire recruitment process.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Care Corner Singapore Ltd was founded in 1981, in a climate of changes in the early 1980s, as economic competition in the region intensified and the rift between the wealthy and the lower-income in particular the Chinese blue-collar workers, widened. Rev Tan Tien Ser and a group of passionate individuals believed that these marginalised people with lower income and little opportunities for a formal education could be helped to realise their potential and become more competent and fulfilled persons. Through a series of early outreach initiatives, Care Corner has evolved into an organisation offering a wide range of programmes and services delivered through various social service centres located island-wide. In a bid to stay relevant to the needs of the community, Care Corner has continuously strived to offer new and innovative programmes to support those in need and the less privileged.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Care Corner Learning and Special Needs Support is looking to expand our focus from just educational therapy to providing wholistic support for children with learning and special needs. We are seeking a Specialist with a passion to support children with learning and special needs. This individual would ideally have experience teaching children individually or in small group sizes, open to working from different locations and keen to teach children in our own Intervention Programme.
Roles & Responsibilities:
Plan and teach English and Math to children (age 5 to 12) with learning difficulties/disabilities.
Plan and conduct individual and group intervention programmes/activites for children with special needs.
Assess the developmental needs of children, doing up each child’s Individual Educational Programme (IEP) and Progress Report (PR) to address the needs of the children in the assigned classes.
Engage parents in executing intervention and development strategies for the children.
Requirements:
Minimum Diploma in Early Childhood/ Pre-School Teaching/ Early Years/ Special Education, Learning DisordersManagement or any other related fields.
Advanced Diploma in Early Childhood Intervention (Special Needs) will be preferred.
Experience in specialised intervention methods with children will be an added advantage (e.g. OG, Jolly Phonics, visual processing training, rhythmic movement training).
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Location: Primarily Tampines. Required to work from different centres, eg. Woodlands, Toa Payoh.
QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum Diploma in Early Childhood/ Pre-School Teaching/ Early Years/ Special Education, Learning Disorders Management or any other related fields
Advanced Diploma in Early Childhood Intervention (Special Needs) will be preferred
OTHER INFORMATION
Thank you for your application. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified for interviews.
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Care Corner Singapore Ltd

title: HSSE Officer, Project Management Office (2 years contract)
company_info: ABOUT SEMBCORP INDUSTRIES (Company registration: 199802418D) Sembcorp Industries (Sembcorp) is a leading energy and urban solutions provider, driven by its purpose to do good and play its part in building a sustainable future. Headquartered in Singapore, Sembcorp leverages its sector expertise and global track record to deliver innovative solutions that support the energy transition and sustainable development. By focusing on growing its Renewables and Integrated Urban Solutions businesses, it aims to transform its portfolio towards a greener future and be a leading provider of sustainable solutions. Sembcorp has a balanced energy portfolio of 16.7GW, with 9.8GW[1] of gross renewable energy capacity comprising solar, wind and energy storage globally*. The company also has a proven track record of transforming raw land into sustainable urban developments, with a project portfolio spanning over 12,000hectares across Asia. Sembcorp is listed on the main board of the Singapore Exchange. It is a constituent stock of the Straits Times Index and sustainability indices including the FTSE4Good Index and the iEdge SG ESG indices. For more information, please visit www.sembcorp.com. [1] Including acquisitions pending completion
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PURPOSE AND SCOPE
Responsible as HSSE officer for project of Project Management Office, Singapore and Southeast Asia (PMO).
KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Direct report to project manager and functional report to PMO HSSE Manager.
Support the project manager in leading and manage projectHSSE related matters.
Advises and supports the project team in interfacing with authorities, and other institutions regarding workplace health, safety, environmental and security issues.
Monitors local laws and regulations and Group HSSE requirements, and imposes measures to ensure that Health, Safety, Environmental and Security compliance and performance expectations are being met.
Attends and provides HSSE inputs during project/ site meetings & PTW meetings.
Conduct HSSE training for project team and vendors.
Create method and plan and conduct site observations, and prepare observation analysis.
Schedules and participates in HSSE inspection programs, including daily site inspections and surveillance during the execution of critical work activities.
Prepares project Emergency Response Procedure and coordinates planned drills as per local legal requirement.
Act as Fire Safety Manager to conduct regular inspections for critical equipment and systems such as firefighting and lifesaving equipment to ensure they are maintained in good working condition
Reviews and provides inputs on MSRA and other safety critical related documents relating to PTW approval.
Initiates and leads in project HSSE Awareness, consultation and engagement program including development and execution of promotional activities and HSSE coaching and training (Safety induction and HSSE critical activities).
Conduct investigation on any HSSE violation incidents and provide the mitigation, prevention and action plan.
Ensure all activities carried out are in full compliance to all regulatory and authority requirement.
Any other necessary activities and/or deliverables for implementation of HSSE requirement.
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Bachelor Degree in Occupational Health, Safety Management or Environmental Science, or Specialist Diploma in WSH (Level C) and Fire Safety Manager or equivalent
Min 5 years of related HSSE experience
Good computer skill (Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
Experience in Power & Utilities industry is a plus
SKILLS/COMPETENCIES & PREFERRED CHARACTERISTICS
Demonstrate critical thinking skill, positive attitude, teamwork, analytical, communication skill, leadership skill.
Can work independently with minimum supervision.
Positive attitude with high self motivation to deliver the outcome
Good stakeholder management skills

title: Credit Control Officer (Contract 6 months - Tai Seng)
company_info: RENTOKIL INITIAL SINGAPORE PRIVATE LIMITED Rentokil Initial is first and foremost a service company. We offer the strengths and expertise of a global organisation, with the advantages of being local. Our services are delivered from over 1,000 local locations. As a service organisation, we believe that it’s our people who make our company what it is – and we have a team of great people, with a shared mission, vision and values. Rentokil Initial comprises a number of global and local brands employing over 29,500 people in over 60 countries where our brands have come to represent consistent quality of service. These include three global brands Rentokil, Initial, Ambius and several country or region specific brands including Pink (Hygiene Services, Australia), Ehrlich and Presto-X (Pest Control, USA) and Calmic (Hygiene Services, Asia). Rentokil is the world’s leading commercial pest control company providing the highest levels of risk management, reassurance and responsiveness to customers. Across the world, businesses and homeowners trust Rentokil to solve their pest problems. We offer a complete range of pest control services from rodents to flying and crawling insects, to other forms of wildlife management. We have a strong innovation pipeline. Our global technical centre provides effective and innovative solutions for pest control with specific emphasis placed on health, safety and protection of the environment. In Singapore, Rentokil leads the industry providing pest control services to the public, commercial sector and residential sector. Our comprehensive pest management solutions for protecting environments, assets and reputations worldwide bears testimony to our commitment to Singapore. Rentokil Pest Control offers unparalleled customised solutions for all customers, whenever and wherever they may arise. Our long-standing experience from working in multiples countries blazes the trail towards, development of innovative and environmentally sensitive solutions. Our three pronged fail-safe plan of exclusion, restriction and destruction has been the cornerstone of our success and reputation as the top provider of pest control services in Singapore and around the world. Initial Hygiene provides a dedicated and expert hygiene service. job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Banking and Finance
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Lead Principal Auditor typically leads complex audits of a specific business/functional area/region, and evaluates the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls relating to risks within those business areas. They typically act as coach for auditors.
They will proactively develop and maintain professional consultative working relationships within their function and with stakeholders inside and outside the bank. They will use a range of approaches to collect relevant information to assess key risks, resolve major issues or carry out tasks across a portfolio.
The Lead Principal Auditor works in a co-operative manner with subject matter experts and other teams from across the function and outside the function to provide ‘front-to-back’ audit coverage and will actively contribute to the delivery of team plans in support of the functional and business strategies. They may occasionally lead ad-hoc projects and special investigations and represent the division at committees and forums, both internally and externally.

Responsibilities:
Reporting to a Principal Audit Manager, the Lead Principal Auditor will work as part of a multi-disciplinary audit team within Singapore. Whilst the work will predominantly focus on auditing the Investment Bank Origination & Advisory Division (Corporate Finance) there will also be the need to cover other areas of the bank from time to time. Based in Singapore, the role will allow for limited travel to other locations, mainly within Asia Pacific.
Execute day-to-day operational audit work and contribute to the delivery of audits (including the Continuous Monitoring process and the updating of Risk Assessment Profiles).
Lead complex audit assignments, draft audit findings / reports for review by audit management, facilitate issue tracking and validate closure of issue.
Lead and execute audit work in line with the agreed audit approach e.g. documenting Activity / Process Flows, identification of key risks and testing of key controls to determine whether they are properly designed and are operating effectively and documenting work in accordance with Group Audit (GA) standards.
Complete all assigned work in line with agreed budgets, including ad hoc projects and special investigations.
Proactively develop and maintain professional working relationships with colleagues, the business and respective support areas.
Partner with other audit teams (regionally and / or globally) such as Risk, Finance, Technology and Operations during audit engagements to ensure comprehensive coverage and an integrated approach to front to back audits of Investment Bank Origination & Advisory and its associated support functions.
Communicate openly with GA management and the internal stakeholders; keep them informed of potential issues and escalate problems / delays accordingly.
Keep abreast of pertinent industry, regulatory and business practices.
Deliver and sustain own performance against key objectives in the context of functional strategies.
Support the development of an environment where people management and development is the number one priority.
Take ownership for own career management, seek opportunities for continuous development of personal capability and improve performance contribution.
Requirements:
Knowledge and experience of financial services particularly Investment Banking products including interest rate, foreign exchange, equity, and structured products, coupled with familiarisation of working within the operational requirements and regulatory environment of a global Bank.
Professional credentials, including degree level education and a relevant professional qualification.
Knowledge of auditing standards and concepts.
Fluency in English and Chinese (written and verbal) languages as this role requires liaising with local, regional and global stakeholders.
A proven track record of meeting client needs in a financial services environment.
Excellent team working capabilities and an ability to build strong business and team relationships. Act as coach for auditors.
Strong strategic / analytical thinking.
Strong project management and planning skills.
Able to convey, complex concepts and ideas on issues requiring interpretation and opinion, in a logical and structured approach.
Able to challenge and be challenged whilst maintaining the highest levels of professionalism.
Experienced in delivering work under tight deadlines.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Statement Of Purpose (Overall Purpose of Job)
Responsible for the overall contract administration, preparation of contract, project estimate and tender, monitoring and control of construction cost, sourcing & negotiation with suppliers and sub-contractors.
Major Duties & Responsibilities
(A) Specific :
Responsible for the overall contract administration and liaison with the project managers and all relevant project staffs on contractual matters including extension of time, contractual claims, variations, and any other related loss and expenses claims to client and/or assessing and review of extension of time, variations, and any related loss and expenses claims by sub-contractors.
Prepare pre and post budget, progress claims, variation claims, projected cashflow, tender documentations and final accounts.
Cash flow management for project.
Track changes in design/construction work and adjust budget projections accordingly.
Sourcing, negotiation and procurement with suppliers and sub-contractors.
Raise queries on discrepancies in tender / contract documents / drawings.
Acting as the main point on contact for clients, site and project managers.
Provide advice and guidance to the different teams relating to contract generation.
Provide support and advice on new potential business opportunities.
Identify opportunities to improve business processes and devise plans to implement these changes.
(B) General :
To prepare cost estimates and submission of tenders / contracts.
To prepare cost estimates and submission of tenders / contracts.
To maintain proper documentation for all tenders/ contracts.
To coordinate and work with other departments.
To engage, coordinate and oversee all tenders to ensure timely submission to Clients.
Other duties as assigned.
(C) Safety :
Follow the safety procedures, rules and regulations and eliminate or reduce hazard at the work place.
Job Requirements
(A) Education, Qualifications & Special Training :
Degree / Diploma in Electrical Engineering/ Quantity Surveying/ Construction Management/ Contract Law.
Job holder without the above qualification but with relevant experience would be considered.
(B) Knowledge & Skills :
Well-versed in Electrical tendering.
Good interpersonal skills.
Independent & Team player.
Proactive and able to take initiative.
Good in negotiation.
Good communication skills (verbal and written).
PC literate and knowledge in MS Office.
(C) Experience :
Preferably with minimum 5 years of relevant experience.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Quantity Surveyor Manager is responsible for taking measurements and drafting tender documentation. He/She is involved in preparing for tender and analysing the tender returns. He/She prepares cost estimates based on technical specifications and prepares costing details for further analyses. He/She is responsible for the complete cost management and contract administration of the project, including preparing claims and final account settlement.

He/She is detail-oriented and meticulous in his work. He/She possesses knowledge of the industry, construction materials, procurement methods and regulations. He/She communicates effectively with a wide range of stakeholders both verbally and in written reports. He/She possess strong numeracy, analytical and problem-solving skills. He/She will usually be stationed in the office and may have to visit work sites to perform his duties.

Prepare measurements and Tender documentation
Use Building Information Modelling (BIM) or any relevant software for the extraction of quantities
Process measurements into various forms of contract bills
Prepare schedule of rates
Assist to draft preliminaries and trade preambles
Assist in the review of technical specifications prepared by technical consultants
Conduct measurements, admeasurements, and re-measurements
Drive cost planning and control
Conduct cost analyses
Prepare outline and detailed approximate cost estimates
Prepare cost plans
Prepare cost-in-use studies and life-cycle costing of building and installation and/or components
Prepare cash flow projections
Conduct cost checking during design development
Conduct cost evaluation of alternative design or method of construction
Prepare periodic cost reports
Define tender and procurement strategies
Assist with pre-qualifications
Adhere to procurement strategies
Prepare tender documents and/or appropriate Conditions of Contract to invite tenders from contractors, specialists or sub-contractors on a competitive or negotiated basis
Analyse tender returns
Support benchmarking activities
Manage post contract administration
Communicate payment regime to relevant stakeholders
Prepare valuations for interim payments and/or recommendations for payment to contractors, specialists and sub-contractors including recommendations for payment
Measure variation of cost claims
Prepare claims on behalf of relevant parties
Prepare final accounts and/or relevant pricing variations
Attend project meetings

Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview
Synapxe Procurement Contract Management department provides contract management support not only for Synapxe own corporate contracts, but also provide consolidated and centralised contract management support for the clinical, business and healthcare analytics IT systems of various public healthcare hospitals and institutions in Singapore. The role will assume the general and specific responsibilities of Contract Management, with particular emphasis on drafting, review and preparation of Requests for Proposals and IT contracts, managing contract templates, renewals, policies and repositories, and advising on legal contracting issues.

Support various stakeholders in respect of governance and approvals before final contract award and execution
Provide administrative and documentation repository support to various stakeholders

Excellent command of English, accurate and concise drafting and writing skills, are essential
Collegial and effective communicator with ability to work with all colleagues and stakeholders
Competent knowledge of basic contract and procurement related laws, and related governance and processes
Agile, analytical and meticulous, with ability to work independently and effectively under pressure

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the Group:

Members of Seagate’s Legal, Government Relations, and Global Trust and Security Department are diverse, dynamic, innovative and engaged. Our attorneys and other professionals work collaboratively as valued business partners to support Seagate’s strategy and objectives.

Our team goals are to Protect Seagate, Deliver Awesome Services, Build Sustainable Relationships, and Build the Best Team.

We do impactful and interesting work, support each other, and have fun.

About the Role:

The Associate General Counsel role will be based out of our Singapore office, and will report to the Deputy General Counsel in the US.

You will lead and manage the Asia commercial contracts team comprising of senior attorneys/professionals from Singapore, China and Thailand.

Together with a collaborative group of professional legal colleagues from around the world, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting, challenging, and often cutting-edge legal issues that require creative and proactive legal advice and client service.

Commercial Contracts
Working with cross-functional clients to support our complex global business, the Asia commercial contracts team provides commercial contract support and general legal advisory services on a broad range of legal issues to business clients primarily in Singapore, China, Thailand, Malaysia and India, as well as in other multiple worldwide sites as required.
The Asia commercial contracts team specializes in both local and cross-border commercial contracts. The team utilizes Seagate standard templates, and works closely with internal requestors and stakeholders to determine business requirements, review terms of contract, identify non-standard terms, and obtain approvals in accordance with Seagate policies.
The team owns the contract workflow and approval processes, and manages the existing contracts database throughout the contract lifecycle, from negotiating, drafting, amending, reviewing, through signing and archiving, with the support of an administrative assistant located in Singapore.
Cross-Functional Support; Other Duties
The Associate General Counsel may also be required to extend support to other areas of the legal department, such as dispute resolution, intellectual property, government relations, compliance and ethics, and labor law, and work with and manage relationships with outside counsel.
You will be required to stay abreast of legislative, regulatory and judicial developments that may affect the company.
You will also have responsibilities in developing and delivering training, supporting audits and other initiatives.
In addition, this role may be asked to take on other further duties per the discretion of management.
About You:

All of the following are desirable knowledge and experience for this role:

Management and Leadership
Law degree or equivalent with admission to practice law and at least 10 years of post-qualification experience.
Competent people manager with strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, invested in employee development and coaching, able to provide direction, guidance and motivation to direct reports, draw out their strengths and support their career development within the company, and create a positive work environment.
An excellent communicator with ability to work independently, as well as successfully collaborate in partnerships across multiple sites in cross-functional projects.
Experience leading and managing a cross-border team of senior attorneys/professionals providing legal and contractual support to business clients in multiple worldwide sites across different time zones.
Detail-oriented, organized, and hard-working.
Ability to develop and maintain strong cross-functional partnerships with all levels of the organization, and be recognized by clients as a trusted and strategic legal business partner that actively participates in problem solving with director level cross-functional peers as well as executive leaders by assessing risks, weighing in and making recommendations to the business.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment with the initiative to take on, manage and drive multiple projects simultaneously under deadline pressure to completion.
Ability to think strategically and critically, lead with confidence and compassion, influence cross-functional teams, solve problems creatively and make decisions.
Possess exceptional interpersonal skills, a sense of humor, unquestionable ethics and integrity, and sound judgment.
Proficient with Microsoft Word and other Microsoft Office 365 products.
Possess excellent verbal and written professional communication skills in English.
Your Experience Includes:

Strong Legal Background
Transactional experience at a law firm, experience working in the corporate legal department for a multinational corporation with a significant emphasis on commercial contract transactions, or comparable experience.
Strong understanding of core legal contracting principles, consequences of contractual language and implications on business transactions.
Ability to skillfully negotiate and draft cross-border contracts.
Ability to spot legal issues, provide competent contract advice, identify and propose well-reasoned risk-based decisions, convert business requirements into contractual requirements, make sound recommendations to cross-functional business units for beneficial business solutions, and provide legal advice that appropriately balances domestic and international perspectives and requirements.
Experience supporting compliance and ethics related activities.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Contract Period: October - December 2023 (3-Months)

Job Description & Requirement
The main responsibilities of the Security Operator are to provide a high level of service to local and remote Client sites and staff with the emphasis on the security and safety of the staff, assets and information.

Key responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
• Monitor operational network video cameras.
• Operate all SOC technologies including network video, access control, etc.
• Coordinate direct action and responses to incidents and alarm activation.
• Compile reports for the SOC Shift Supervisor in order to share with management on a daily/weekly/monthly basis.
• Exceptional communication skills at all times and an ability to adopt the appropriate approach when dealing with others who may be anxious or distressed.
• Provide high quality written and verbal reports as and when required.
• Taking telephone enquiries.
• Maintain accurate logs of events.
• Liaise with emergency services and other monitoring agents as and when directed.
• Assist in the collation and preservation of digital media evidence.
• Assist in the collation and viewing of network video images in response to incident investigation in line with associated code of practice.
• Identify and promptly respond to any system anomalies.
• Support the SOC Shift Manager in monitoring regional travel requests and travel movements.
• Under minimal supervision determine the appropriate response to each reported incident.
• Maintain active awareness of the monitored environment to promote safe and effective working.
• Maintain a conscientious and proactive approach to work to achieve excellent standards.

Working Hours
• Rotating Shift Pattern
• 24 Working Days (Deployed for 15 Days, Standby for 9 Days)

Requirements
• Minimum 2 years’ experience working with or in Operations Center related operation
• Professional qualifications related to Security Operations
• Valid PLRD License

To apply for the "SOC OPERATOR" position, please submit your resume via the “Apply Now” option.

company_info: Zenith Infotech (S) Pte Ltd. was started in 1997, primarily with the vision of offering state-of-the-art IT Professionals and solutions to various organizations and thereby helping them increase their productivity and competitiveness. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This is a 12 months contract assigned to our client

Work Location: To be confirmed
Salary Range : $3,500-$4,000

Work Timing
1. Mon to Fri – 9 am to 6 PM with one hour lunch break.
2. All Saturdays would be a half day working for him/her (4 hours).
3. All Sundays and Public Holidays will be rest days.

Call Center Trainer
Job Description:
We are looking for a dynamic call center trainer to join our company. In this role, you'll be responsible for scheduling and conducting training sessions for both new and experienced call center agents, managing the training budget, and supporting employees to keep productivity up.
To ensure success as a call center trainer, you should have excellent knowledge of call center procedures and expertise in quality assurance. Ultimately, a top-notch call center trainer should be a friendly, approachable individual with effective teaching and communication skills.

Call Center Trainer Responsibilities:
1. Developing call centers' education materials, such as digital presentations, how-to manuals, and instructional videos.
2. Preparing procedures and policies regarding sales techniques and appropriate agent conduct.
3. Scheduling and conducting training sessions on various call center topics to prepare and support new employees.
4. Training experienced employees on new or updated call center procedures to improve their performance.
5. Observing the daily operations of call center employees and identifying any areas of improvement.
6. Liaising with team leaders and managers to conduct on-the-job coaching.
7. Measuring the effectiveness of training sessions and preparing individual or team progress reports.
8. Creating and managing the training budget.
9. Ensuring employees keep up their productivity and maintain high levels of customer satisfaction.

Call Center Trainer Requirements:
1. A bachelor's degree in human resources, or a related field.
2. Additional certification in business leadership, eLearning software, or adult education and training is preferred.
3. At least 4 year's experience working as a call center trainer or team leader.
4. Familiarity with learning management systems, such as Google Classroom, Blackboard, and Schoology.
5. Excellent knowledge of sales techniques and customer service best practices.
6. Strong teaching abilities and mentoring skills.
7. Good communication, interpersonal, and conflict resolution skills.
8. Ability to provide leadership to personnel in a fast-paced and stressful work environment.
