title: Quality Assurance Lead (Call Centre) - Contract = 12 months
company_info: Zenith Infotech (S) Pte Ltd. was started in 1997, primarily with the vision of offering state-of-the-art IT Professionals and solutions to various organizations and thereby helping them increase their productivity and competitiveness. From deployment of one person to formation of whole IT teams, Zenith Infotech has helped clients with their staff augmentation needs. Zenith offers opportunity to be engaged in long term projects with large IT savvy companies, Consulting organizations, System Integrators, Government, and MNCs.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This is a 12 months contract assigned to our clients

Work Location: To be confirmed
Salary Range : $3,000-$4,500

Objectives of QA:
• Propose a service quality plan which will detail the quality assurance measures, the method of accountability, the performance indicators, quality management
oversight, contractual requirements, timeline, and ways to evaluate the effectiveness of the plan to the Authority for endorsement before the commencement date of the Contract.
• Inculcate service quality mindset amongst the CSOs; nurture a service culture.
• Incorporate the survey script and conduct customer satisfaction survey for each call CSO received for customer service satisfaction audit purposes.
• Review the survey results of the customer satisfaction survey and implement improvement measures/plans.
• Coach CSOs on the service quality standards (e.g.1-to-1 training).
• Conduct monthly or ad-hoc internal audits each month to ensure continual demonstration of the satisfactory service quality by the CSOs, including adherence to the Public Service’s No Wrong Door policy, First Responder Protocol, the Authority’s Service Standards and KPI Standards.

Responsibilities of QA:
• Perform transaction monitoring audits in accordance with the Authority’s agreed Marking Guidelines.
• Highlight and coach/arrange coaching the identified outliers on the respective non-compliance.
• To prepare and broadcast innovative quality initiatives like infographics.
• Execute investigations and provided findings as well as corrective actions in the event non-conformities are identified.
• Work with CCM, Trainer and Team Leaders on quality initiatives and facilitate reward programs.
• Perform Post Call Survey Validation and call out to lowly rated surveys to understand reason for failure.
• Validate Compliments and compile types of errors, service lapses/complaints and submit via Feedback Tracker to client weekly.
• Analyzes the raw data and identifies areas that require attention such as high occurrence of the same error and reoccurrence of error by same CSO.
• Highlight any concerns to CCM, Trainer and Team Leaders for discussion after coaching sessions.
• Providing inputs and ensuring that the required QA reports are completed in a timely manner for provision to client
• To cover Trainer’s job duties during Trainer’s absence.

Skills and Qualifications:

• A recognized diploma or its equivalent with at least 3 years of experience in the contact centre industry
• Deep knowledge of quality assurance terminology, methods, and tools.
• Superb computer skills, including database management and meticulous in handling large data.
• Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
• Proficiency in best practices for version control.
• Understanding of agile/scrum methodology and how QA functions within it.
• Fluency in more than one language.

title: KC12794254 Accounts Receivable Analyst, Collections (12 months contract)
company_info: ROBERT HALF INTERNATIONAL PTE. LTD. Founded in 1948, Robert Half (NYSE symbol: RHI) pioneered specialised recruitment services and today - with more than 325 staffing locations worldwide - Robert Half is the world's leader in placing accounting, finance, banking and technology professionals on a temporary and permanent basis. In Singapore, Robert Half operates four divisions: Robert Half Finance and Accounting: Recruitment services for temporary and permanent finance and accounting personnel Robert Half Financial Services: Recruitment services for high-calibre financial services, insurance and banking professionals Robert Half Management Resources: Recruitment services for senior-level finance, accounting and business systems professionals on a project and interim basis Robert Half Technology: Recruitment services for temporary and permanent IT professionals Robert Half also is the parent company of Protiviti®, a global consulting and internal audit firm composed of experts in risk, advisory and transaction services.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Company
Our client is a US MNC and Fortune 100 company in the technology industry. They are looking to hire an Accounts Receivable Analyst (Collections) on a 12 months contract basis.
The Role
You will be responsible for ensuring that the accounts receivable portfolio turns into cash, initiating collection calls on assigned account base, facilitating customer payment, resolving customer billing disputes, escalating problem collection accounts to credit and sales management. You will also be involved in negotiating payment plans, working with credit analyst on financial distress accounts, participating in process improvement projects, providing reports on assigned portfolio etc.
Your Profile
You should have a minimum of 2-3 years’ experience in a similar capacity and have good customer relationship skills, good communication skills, able to work independently in a fast-paced environment, be well organized and possess good time management skills.
Apply Today
Please send your resume, in WORD format only and quote reference number KC12794254, by clicking the apply button. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

title: AML Onboarding Senior Analyst (6 months contract)
company_info: We enable our clients to be better investors. More opportunity. More potential. More impact. We offer investment expertise across all key asset classes, regions and markets so that our clients can capture investment potential wherever it arises. By combining market and economic insight with technology and diverse perspectives, we look for optimal ways to help investors navigate the future and reach their financial goals. And by putting environmental, social and governance (ESG) considerations at the heart of our process, we seek to find the most sustainable investment opportunities globally. By ensuring the assets we invest in are ready for and resilient to a world in transition, we act as guardians of our clients’ assets. Focus on fundamental research The combination of our research, thematic thinking, ESG best practice and extensive on-the-ground analysis helps us find the most sustainable future-fit investment opportunities globally. Operating in over 30 locations worldwide* Keeping us close to our clients and ensuring first-hand insight into companies, industries and markets Managing £465.3bn in assets for our clients* On behalf of individuals, governments, pension funds, insurers, companies, charities and foundations across 80 countries *All data facts and figures as at 30 June 2021
address: MARINA ONE EAST TOWER, 7 STRAITS VIEW 018936
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At abrdn, enabling our clients to be better investors drives everything we do.
Through the expertise, insight and innovation of our team, we aim to help clients create more ways for money to make an impact. We set our sights on giving them more confidence to achieve their goals, and more clarity about what they need next. And we focus on delivering outcomes that are more than just financial – by investing responsibly to build a better world.

Role Context
abrdn is seeking a passionate individual to take on the role of an AML Onboarding Senior Analyst (6 months contract) within the Client Group function and Client Service team, reporting to the Head of AML Onboarding – Asia Pacific. The role will be based in Singapore and is expected to work in a team.
The Client Service function is responsible for day-to-day administrative support of existing clients. The AML Onboarding team focus specializes in coordinating activities with functions including operations , business development, marketing, custodian banks, transfer agents, legal and compliance, reporting team, RFP and presentation team, investment and asset class specialists as well as resolving administrative and operations problems.

Job Description
· Ensure clients meet applicable CDD/AML requirements and that the appropriate CDD/AML process is followed for all new client mandates to mitigate risk
· Answer clients’ CDD/AML related query
· Ensure that all completed AML/KYC documentation is properly filed, stored and retrievable
· Provide support on client periodic reviews and remediation
· Conduct and review name screening according to our CDD/AML requirement
· Conduct regular transactions monitoring for specific client types
· Liaise between Client Services, Business Development team, Transfer Agency and Compliance from different countries (HK, SG, China, Malaysia, Luxembourg, UK, etc.) for CDD including handling various approval inquiry
· Provide support to the Business Development team with AML/KYC queries
· Provide support to the production of qualitative reports
· Provide support to team members on project initiatives

Job Requirement
· Bachelor’s degree desirable
· Have extensive knowledge of CDD/AML requirement for different jurisdictions
· Ability to speak, read and write English, traditional or simplified Chinese documents
· Preferably have completed ACAM certificate or its equivalent

Please apply directly to this link (copy and paste into your browser):
https://abrdn.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/abrdn/job/Singapore/AML-Onboarding-Senior-Analyst_R0070925

Our Inclusive Culture
We have a long-term commitment to building inclusive workplaces; we value diversity in our workforce and welcome enquiries from everyone. If you need assistance or a reasonable adjustment due to a disability please let us know as part of your application and we will assist.

title: Recruitment Consultant [Non-Tech / Contract staffing / Basic + Comms] - 3427
company: APBA TG HUMAN RESOURCE PTE. LTD.
company_info: APBA TG Human Resource Pte Ltd (a wholly owned subsidiary of the TG Group) TG Group (“TG”) is a global workforce solutions provider with an international reach in over 50 markets across the globe. Headquartered in Singapore with Shanghai Foreign Service (Group) Co Ltd ("FSG") as a strategic shareholder, TG delivers a comprehensive suite of innovative human capital solutions to help our clients achieve greater business success. TG adopts a future-centric approach where we aspire to be at the forefront of the evolution of the future of work. We believe that human capital is the greatest asset to any institution. With a wealth of experience in the Human Resources (HR) industry, we combine our international expertise and local know-how to deliver bespoke and innovative workforce solutions. Our diverse portfolio of client-centric workforce solutions includes Contingent Workforce Management (CWM), Business Process Outsourcing (BPO), Permanent Placements, Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO), Professional Employer Organisation (PEO), and Payroll Process Outsourcing (PPO).
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This role sits within the contract staffing team and will be working on non-tech, corporate function roles across all levels of seniority and industries.
Responsibilities:
Client Management
Maintain contact through calls and visits to establish strong relationship.
Align suitable candidates with client’s needs.
Work closely with clients to understand their job requirement and candidate preference
Keep records of successful placements (Temporary, Contract, Permanent) with respective clients.
Candidate Management
Creating a strategy in sourcing for candidates.
Compile candidates’ reports and summarize data gathered to ensure absolute accuracy.
Interact and assess applicants with pre-determined criteria to determine their potential suitability for the job.
Conduct general interview with job seekers to create a pool of candidates ready to fill vacancies.
Manage candidates’ expectations and ensure that they are realistic as well as provide advice whenever necessary.
Providing candidates with tips and advice on their CVs and interview technique.
Verbally reject unsuitable candidates and evaluate them for other job opportunities.
Maintaining regular contact with candidates to ensure strong relationship.
Arrange interviews for candidates with clients and follow up with candidates after the interview process with the client.
Establish and maintaining a constant pool of candidates through sourcing.
Administer Letter of Appointment with candidates, where applicable.
Systems and Operations
Adhere to all administrative procedures
Complete assigned administrative work.
Periodically update all relevant job postings.
Check and ensure that all reports and documents are accurate and updated.
Coordinate information between client and candidate whenever necessary.
Ensure that candidates’ database is kept accurate and up to date.
Maintain a record of all contacts with clients, candidates and scheduled meetings.
People and Team

company_info: Zenith Infotech (S) Pte Ltd. was started in 1997, primarily with the vision of offering state-of-the-art IT Professionals and solutions to various organizations and thereby helping them increase their productivity and competitiveness. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This is a 12 months contract assigned to our client

Work Location: To be confirmed
Salary Range : $6,000-$8,000

Primary Skill:
1. SAP FI CO Finance
2. Procure to Pay (P2P) Process Design

Job Description
1. ABAP Development:
Develop and modify custom ABAP programs for FI modules, reports, enhancements, forms, and interfaces to meet business requirements.
Design, code, test, and debug ABAP programs in accordance with development standards and best practices.
Utilize SAP technologies such as ABAP Object Oriented Programming, BAPIs, User Exits, BADI, Enhancement Framework, and more.

2. Integration and Interfaces:
Collaborate with functional and technical teams to design and implement interfaces between SAP and
external systems using various technologies (IDoc, RFC, Web Services, etc.).
Ensure seamless data exchange and integration across different SAP modules and external applications.

3. Functional Knowledge:
Need to have background of SAP Finance module includes AP,AR,GL, Asset accounting, Banking module & Fund Management as optional.
Identify opportunities for performance optimization in existing Finance ABAP programs and take necessary actions to enhance system efficiency.

4. Technical Documentation:
Create and maintain technical specifications, design documentation, and user manuals for ABAP developments.
Document code changes, configurations, and developments in alignment with organizational standards.

5. Testing and Quality Assurance:
Conduct unit testing, integration testing, and regression testing of ABAP developments to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Collaborate with functional teams to validate the developed solutions against business requirements.

6. Support and Maintenance:
Provide production support by investigating and resolving issues related to custom developments and integrations.
Perform code enhancements, corrections, and updates as required to address business needs and system improvements.

title: Executive / Senior / Deputy Principal Engineer (Infrastructure Planning and Design Department 1) – Contract until Mar 2026
company_info: The National Environment Agency (NEA) is the leading public organisation responsible for ensuring a clean and sustainable environment for Singapore. Its key roles are to improve and sustain a clean environment, promote sustainability and resource efficiency, maintain high public health standards, provide timely and reliable meteorological information, and encourage a vibrant hawker culture. NEA works closely with its partners and the community to develop and spearhead environmental and public health initiatives and programmes. It is committed to motivating every individual to care for the environment as a way of life, in order to build a liveable and sustainable Singapore for present and future generations. For more information, visit www.nea.gov.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What the role is
The department plans and carries out the engineering design and development of infrastructures for collection of general waste and disposal of waste treatment residues, and redevelopment of closed landfills. You will be part of the Landfill Development branch in charge redevelopment of closed landfill. You will be required to work closely with various stakeholders in the government & private sectors.
What you will be working on
The Executive/Senior/Dy Principal Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the operational readiness of waste infrastructure. He/she will be part of the operations team to leading a team of engineering executives and specialists to ensure safe and optimal operation of waste infrastructure. The key responsibilities in this post include conducting engineering feasibility studies, environmental impact assessments, planning, design/financial review and formulate programme/action plans. He/she will be responsible to call/administer tenders that are undertaken by the team. For projects with construction phases, he/she will have to supervise and lead a team of engineers to ensure a timely implementation of the development.
Oversee the development of the various development projects, obtain planning approval and funding support.
Plan and implement project schedules in accordance to contract and requirements.
Oversee and manage and administer the procurement process to select and appoint project consultants and contractors.
Manage consultants in carrying out feasibility/prelim design/detailed design studies.
Supervise and manage consultants/contractors to ensure that the waste infrastructures are developed in a timely and cost-effective manner, in compliance with the tender requirements.
Plan and manage funding and budget planning cycles for projects.
Work and liaise with various internal and external stakeholders of projects.
Develop, coordinate, and maintain plans and exercises to ensure operational readiness of waste infrastructure.
Develop, maintain, and update capability building management framework to ensure sustained knowledge for the operation and maintenance of waste infrastructure.
Monitor and assess storage needs of contaminated waste and developments overseas to ensure robust design and safe operation of waste infrastructure.
What we are looking at
Engineering graduates are welcomed to apply.
Degree in Civil, Electrical, Mechanical Engineering with 3-5 years of experience in development and construction project management would be advantageous
Knowledge in project management, environmental impact assessment, environmental baseline study, building plans and engineering drawings would be advantageous
A good team player with strong interpersonal skills
Mature, independent, resourceful, and highly self-motivated
Adaptable to diverse work scopes
Good written and spoken communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.
To apply, please proceed to https://sggovterp.wd102.myworkdayjobs.com/PublicServiceCareers/job/NEA-HQ-ENVIRONMENT-BUILDING/Exec-Snr-Dy-Prin-Engr--Infra-Plg-and-Design-Dept-1----Contract-until-Mar-2026_JR-10000023168-1

title: IT Administrator - Contract Term
company: SHUN TAK REAL ESTATE (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
company_info: OPENING IN MID-2023 A LUXURY VERTICAL OASIS IN THE HEART OF SINGAPORE Inspired by Singapore’s culture, colours, and flavours, Artyzen Singapore is a fresh interpretation of luxury. The site of this 142-room contemporary hotel was once named Villa Marie, the sprawling tropical-garden mansion of the grandson of Singapore philanthropist Tan Tock Seng. Embracing this unique heritage, Artyzen Hospitality Group worked in partnership with renowned architect ONG&ONG Pte Ltd and interior design studio Nic Graham & Assoc. to transform this lush property into a luxury vertical oasis in the heart of Singapore.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Highlights
Pre-opening team
Dynamic work environment
Open and collaborative culture
Opening in 2023, Artyzen Singapore will be the first new hotel added to Singapore’s Orchard Road district in over a decade. What was once the sprawling home of the late Tan Hoon Siang (grandson of Singapore philanthropist Tan Tock Seng) is being transformed into a 20-story luxury property. The 142 rooms will sport a distinctive aesthetic, fusing reinterpreted facets of Peranakan art and style with contemporary design.

What:
Assist with information technology support and troubleshooting ensuring the highest level of computer performance, efficiency and security.

Your Goals:
To ensure hotel hardware, software and all IT related systems are functioning and assist guests with IT related services (testing of wifi connectivity issues)

Responsibilities:

A. Assist with Incident Resolution
1. Provide support on IT related services

B. Maintain Systems
1. Inspect, test and diagnose computer equipment/systems (Windows 11, etc)
2. Provide end-user support for all applications

C. Provide IT Support
1. Provide network communications support
2. Install, configure, manage, maintain, test and evaluate computer networks and workstations
3. Create user accounts and setup computer, telephone and other IT related equipment
4. Troubleshoot, modify, support, manage and maintain application programs and user accounts
5. Maintain inventory of all technological hardware and devices
6. Support Corporate IT in new initiative set up or implementation, where applicable

Requirements:
Professional Certification in Information Technology (IT) or related field.
Minimum of 1 year of experience in Information Technology (IT), preferably within the hospitality industry.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a focus on collaboration and open communication.
Strong organizational and project management skills, with an ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Passionate and enthusiastic with a positive ‘can-do’ attitude

title: Career Ambassador / Advisor (Temporary Contract) [CSD]
company_info: Workforce Singapore (WSG) is a statutory board under the Ministry of Manpower (MOM). It will oversee the transformation of the local workforce and industry to meet ongoing economic challenges. WSG will promote the development, competitiveness, inclusiveness, and employability of all levels of the workforce. This will ensure that all sectors of the economy are supported by a strong, inclusive Singaporean core. While its key focus is to help workers meet their career aspirations and secure quality jobs at different stages of life, WSG will also address the needs of business owners and companies by providing support to enable manpower-lean enterprises to remain competitive. It will help businesses in different economic sectors create quality jobs, develop a manpower pipeline to support industry growth, and match the right people to the right jobs.
address: PAYA LEBAR QUARTER, 1 PAYA LEBAR LINK 408533
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview of position
The Career Ambassador/ Advisor of the Workforce Singapore Agency provides career advisory and guidance on job placement strategies for jobseekers. Your role will be to engage, advise, serve and facilitate a jobseeker’s visit and address needs through Careers Connect’s services and programmes. You will be Careers Connect’s first point of touch and brand ambassador to the public and individuals requiring our services. You will be deployed to represent WSG at Community Clubs located across the island.
In alignment with WSG’s mission and the Careers Connect’s brand, you are passionate and constantly seek to raise jobseekers’ performance and employability levels through leveraging their personal strengths while upholding utmost confidentiality in a trusted partnership. You will join like-minded Career Ambassadors and Career Coaches in delivering professional and personalised career services to jobseekers. Armed with a listening ear and an empathic heart ready to serve – you are poised to deliver an excellent and meaningful service experience across WSG’s Careers Connect conduit and PA Community Clubs, where we serve and prepare our local workforce and employers for a lifetime of career transition and transformation respectively.


Tasks, Duties and Responsibilities (TDRs)

Triaging and Right Servicing
• Warmly welcome and service jobseekers requiring Careers Connect’s services.
• Guide jobseekers through Careers Connect’s host of career development resources.
• Render motivation and emotional support to jobseekers undergoing employment-related challenges.
• Conduct career profiling, intake interviews and assessments to holistically understand jobseekers’ needs and challenges.
• Recommend and propose for jobseekers to suitable career interventions and programmes.

Career Development and Job Search
• Establish rapport with jobseekers for effective working partnership and case management.
• Obtain commitment and collaboration with jobseekers to carry out the agreed intervention plan.
• Follow up and perform basic case management for jobseekers as they progress through our services and programmes.
• Provide timely update on jobseekers’ profiles and services rendered via an in-house client management and reporting system.

Provide Labour Market Information and Job Placement
• Engage employers to understand hiring requirements and job-fit.
• Perform job-matching and job referrals for jobseekers to achieve job placement targets.
• Provide up-to-date information on labour market trends, occupational insights to address jobseeker’s needs.
• Refer jobseekers to relevant workforce programmes and national schemes to enhance their capabilities.


Job Requirements

• Tertiary qualification with at least 5 years of demonstrated experience in at least one industry domain.
• Training and experience in career development facilitation, social work, psychology and/ or counselling is a preferred.
• Empathetic, resourceful, proactive, enterprising, professional and persuasive.
• Strong business writing and communication skills.
• The ability to converse in Mother Tongue is a preferred.
• Demonstrated commitment towards helping Singaporeans on their career journey and raising their employability level for job placement.
• Experience in service excellence or CRM will be welcomed.



All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

title: Credit Risk Analyst - 1 year contract
company_info: We live in a fast-paced, highly interconnected world. Technology has transformed the way we live, work, bank and pay. We want to revolutionise banking as we know it today, by leveraging the extensive ecosystems, technology expertise and fintech experiences of our parent companies, Grab and Singtel, to serve everyday consumers and small businesses better. Join us today to empower Southeast Asia's everyday consumers and entrepreneurs.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reporting to the Head of Credit Risk, you will be focused on the analysis and reporting of credit risk metrics including key performance indicators of the retail lending portfolio. This will also cover the development and enhancement of periodic reporting and MIS for the broader business.

Job Responsibilities:
Design, build, implement and maintain credit risk reports.
Analyse and report portfolio KPIs to the Bank’s senior management, ensuring information is accurate.
Analysis of credit risk data against past and expected trends to sufficiently explain key portfolio variance / performance drivers.
Portfolio analysis, monitoring and reporting.
Perform system UATs for credit risk-related systems (with a focus on reporting tools).
Employ advanced analytics and data visualisation to support credit portfolio. management and business needs.
Conduct regular portfolio performance analyses including limit utilisation and to identify segments for credit limit review.
Work with Collections using customer repayment behaviour to identify the possibility of fraudulent applications, and escalate such cases to the Fraud team for investigation.
Assist in building predictive models using machine learning to facilitate credit decisioning and early warning.
Deploy, monitor, and maintain the models on production credit systems.
Work with data engineers to construct data pipelines to integrate new data feeds.
Advance the discussion on governance and assurance regarding the use of artificial intelligence and machine learning in credit risk applications.
Provide analytical / statistical data to support recommendation to enhance credit policies, scoring, segmentation, simulation techniques and management actions to be taken.
Provide inputs on test scenarios and using outcomes, provide recommendations to changes in parameter settings as well as changes in policies.
Proactively engage the Credit Risk Managers on portfolio shape, trends and abnormalities in the portfolio movements.
Assist in ongoing Credit Risk enhancement projects (vendor selection and management, systems implementations, etc.).
Our Ideal Candidate
Bachelor’s or postgraduate degree, preferably in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics or an equivalent quantitative area.
At least three years of relevant experience in banking (preferably in a risk, business or product role for a retail lending portfolio). At least five years’ experience preferred.
Familiarity with the Singapore retail lending market and regulatory environment strongly preferred.
Proficient with MS Office suite or equivalent. (Familiarity with Google Workspace preferred.)
Proficiency in machine learning frameworks, Python and SQL preferred.
Ability to produce high quality analysis using structured and unstructured data.
An enthusiastic team player who can figure it out, get stuff done, have fun and is excellent in communication and stakeholder management.

Based in Singapore, the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and top-ranked biopharmaceutical company on the Straits Times and Statista’s list of Best Employers in Singapore for two consecutive years (2020, 2021).

Provides technical guidance in support of site projects and responsible to transfer the knowledge of the project and facility to integrated process team colleagues.

Supports routine supply manufacture by providing on going technical support to the operations function, participates in Tier (meeting) processes and implement opportunities for improvement utilizing Company Production Systems tools.
Proactively monitors the performance of process parameters, critical quality attributes and equipment/module(s)/unit operation(s) performance during manufacturing and cleaning.
Any other duties as assigned by the Supervisor.
WHAT YOU MUST HAVE

Bachelor or Masters Degree in a technical field, including Chemical/ Mechanical Engineering, or Pharmaceutical Sciences
Minimum 2 years of technical experience in oil and gas, semiconductor industries preferred
Knowledge of problem-solving tools (such as fishbone analysis, 5 WHY, logic fault tree etc.) and troubleshooting skills

Attention to detail

title: Admin Assistant, Junior Art (4 month contract)
company_info: Established in 1938, the Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA) is a pioneer arts institution in Singapore. The Academy is known for its rigorous and high-quality curriculum, innovative and practitioners-led teaching approach, diverse artistic creations and community outreach. NAFA has nurtured 13 recipients of the Cultural Medallion – Singapore’s highest accolade bestowed on art practitioners who have significantly impacted arts and culture. Another 14 alumni have been presented the Young Artist Award. Many of the Academy’s alumni have gone on to make their mark in the professional arts scene in Singapore and abroad. The Academy offers full-time diploma and degree programmes across three schools: the School of Art & Design (fine art, design and media, fashion studies and 3D design), the School of Music and the School of Arts Management, Dance & Theatre. Degree courses are offered in partnership with reputable universities in the United Kingdom. NAFA’s courses are designed and delivered by art educators and practitioners with internationally recognised qualifications. Working with leading industry practitioners, NAFA’s academic schools regularly review and refine their curricula to reflect the changing needs of the industry. Since 1999, NAFA has received polytechnic-level funding from Singapore’s Ministry of Education. In 2011, NAFA became the first comprehensive arts education institution in Singapore to be awarded the four-year EduTrust certificate from the Committee for Private Education. It received its second four-year certification in 2015. NAFA is also the first private arts education institution to launch a government-funded degree programme, namely the Bachelor of Music with Honours degree course in partnership with the Royal College of Music (RCM) in London. The course marks the first time that RCM is conferring its degrees outside the United Kingdom. The learning and research needs of NAFA’s students and faculty are supported by the resources and activities of the Institute of Southeast Asian Arts (ISEAA), the Tanoto Foundation Centre for Southeast Asian Arts and the NAFA Library. Through academic exchanges, seminars and workshops, NAFA maintains a constant dialogue with educators and scholars across the region and beyond. NAFA’s three purpose-built campus buildings are located in Singapore’s Arts & Heritage District, within walking distance to major performing venues, museums and arts groups. The school’s newest addition, the Tower Block at NAFA Campus 1, is an eight-storey extension above the Bencoolen MRT station with new state-of-the-art classrooms, dance and visual arts studios as well as student interaction and self-study areas. With a rich heritage, established track record and an unwavering dedication to the highest standards of arts education, NAFA strives to live up to its mission “to inspire learning and growth through the arts”.

title: Informatica System Analyst (Contract / Informatica / PowerCenter 10)
company_info: Tangspac Consulting is an award-winning professional staffing firm with a 20-year footprint in Asia and headquarters in Singapore dating back to 1993. It offers bespoke contingency search and professional services across various Finance & Technology sectors. Our team of consultants has unparalleled expertise and track-record in serving both buy-side and sell-side firms, including the largest names on Wall Street. We have successfully placed thousands of banking professionals across various business & technology verticals. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position: Informatica System Analyst
Headcounts: x4
Location: Alexandra
Mode of work: Hybrid

Job Description:
The main objective is to analyze, develop, enhance, debug, support, maintain, test informatica application.
The primary work comprises of requirement analysis, mapping design, technical specification, programming, code review, job scheduling, perform unit test and SIT, support UAT, deploy to production, post implementation support, and technical documentation.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for installing, configuring, testing and maintaining Informatica PowerCenter software
Responsible for reviewing and understanding requirements and translating them into high-level and low-level documentation including source to target mapping
Responsible for building of data mappings, sessions and workflows to meet requirements (Informatica 10.x or higher)
Responsible for development of job schedules that integrate the upstream and downstream systems (e.g. Control-M)
Responsible for unit testing, debugging, and performance testing, with key focus on data accuracy and integrity
Accountable for on-time delivery of all documentation, design, build, testing, and deployment according to the work breakdown structures
Work with production support teams as required to support production activities, including production migrations, continuity testing, environment migration activities
Must have impeccable written and oral communication skills down to the mapping documentation level
Ensure that documentation is captured, maintained, understood by and available to business and/or IT partners
Escalate critical technical issues and potential problems as needed to the Project Manager to address any related issues in advance of deadlines

Job Requirements:
Should be independent, quick learner and team player
Able to work independently with minimum guidance
Have good communication skills (to work with various levels)
Minimum 4 years or above with the relevant experience
Proficiency in Informatica PowerCenter 10.x or higher preferably in a Unix (Linux/AIX) environment with AS400/Oracle sources and targets.
Must have experience in Oracle 19c or higher (SQL*Plus, PL/SQL)/Experience in Unix Shell Scripting (Linux/AIX)
Experience Job scheduling tools like Control-M
Good to have experience in Change Control Management tools & Visio
Have experience on all stages of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Able to do requirement gathering, impact analysis, ETL mapping, build, unit testing, support SIT/UAT/Production
Able to organize and prioritize assignments in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment

If keen, kindly forward your CV to stefan.olsem@tangspac.com

Tangspac Consulting Pte Ltd
#03-02 The Octagon, 105 Cecil Street, Singapore 069534

title: English Teacher (Contract Specialist English and Writing Teacher)
company: WRITE EDGE LEARNING CENTRE (BC) PTE. LTD.
company_info: At Write Edge, we specialise in providing high-quality English and Writing tuition classes for Primary and Secondary school students in Singapore. The English enrichment centre was founded in 2014 with a vision to deliver exceptionally effective lessons that help to build a strong foundation in the English language and nurture writing skills in young students. From just 12 students and 1 branch in Lorong Ah Soo, Singapore, Write Edge has since expanded to 7 physical branches,1 online arm called WELearn and also offer online classes to students in Malaysia. With decades of combined teaching, curriculum and education management experience, we’ve got a well-seasoned team at the helm. We work very hard to help our students have the best experience at Write Edge and take great pride in what we do. Our Vision: To be Singapore's Leading English and Writing Enrichment Specialist Our Mission: To make the Mastery of English and Writing possible for every student http://write-edge.com/careers instagram.com/writeedgecareers/
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Join Our Team: Inspire Young Minds as a Specialist English and Writing Teacher!

Are you fueled by a deep passion for teaching and shaping the growth of young minds? If your answer is a resounding YES, then we are excited to welcome you aboard!

About Write Edge: At Write Edge, we're on a mission to empower students with the essential skills of English and writing that extend far beyond the classroom. We're searching for like-minded educators to become part of our team as Specialist English and Writing Teachers across all our vibrant locations in Singapore.

As a Specialist English and Writing Teacher, you will:
Lead intimate class settings with up to 8 students, leveraging our meticulously crafted teaching materials.
Collaborate on curriculum enhancements and contribute to special projects, fostering your creative spirit.
We're Seeking Educators Who:
English Proficiency: Exhibit advanced English communication skills (minimum B3 in English Language for O Levels / A Levels)
Teaching and Nurturing: Possess a remarkable aptitude for teaching combined with a nurturing approach towards children. It’ll be a preferred advantage if you hold prior teaching experience
Curriculum Familiarity: Have a deep familiarity with the Singaporean curriculum and assessment systems.
Positive Attitude: Embrace a confident and positive learning attitude, while demonstrating responsibility and a strong work ethic.
Flexibility: Are available to work on Saturdays and/or Sundays and can travel between Write Edge centres for classes when needed.
What Sets Us Apart:
Empower Your Growth: Comprehensive training and ready-to-use teaching materials for your journey to success.
Rewarding Recognition: Experience a compelling remuneration package that truly values your contributions.
Continuous Development: Unlock in-house training opportunities to continuously enhance your skills and expertise.
Holistic Well-being: Engage in our company-wide well-being initiatives and embrace a vibrant community of educators.
Work Hours:
4 weekdays and 1 weekend

Centres' Operating Hours:
2023:
Weekdays: 1pm - 10pm
Weekend: 830am - 630pm

Why Choose Write Edge? By joining Write Edge, you're not just securing a job; you're becoming an integral part of a community dedicated to nurturing minds and shaping futures. Together, we're transforming education, one student at a time.

Ready to Embark on this Exciting Journey? Discover what it's like to be part of the Write Edge team – a journey driven by passion, growth, and educational excellence. Learn more about your potential future at Write Edge by visiting https://www.write-edge.com/careers/.

We look forward to welcoming you to our team of dedicated educators who are shaping the leaders of tomorrow.

title: Trainee - 12 months' contract - Global Markets Flow Derivatives Strategist
company_info: Société Générale Societe Generale is one of the largest European financial services groups. Based on a diversified and integrated banking model, the Group combines financial solidity with a strategy of sustainable growth, and aims to be the reference for relationship banking, recognised on its markets, close to clients, chosen for the quality and commitment of its teams. Societe Generale has been playing a vital role in the economy for 150 years. With more than 145,000 employees, based in 66 countries, we serve on a daily basis 31 million clients throughout the world. Societe Generale’s teams offer advice and services to individual, corporate and institutional customers in three core businesses: Retail banking in France with the Societe Generale branch network, Credit du Nord and Boursorama, offering a comprehensive range of multi-channel financial services at the leading edge of digital innovation; International retail banking, insurance and financial services to corporates with a presence in developing economies and leading specialised businesses; Corporate and investment banking, private banking, asset management and securities services, with recognised expertise, top international rankings and integrated solutions. Societe Generale in Asia Pacific Societe Generale’s first presence in Asia dates back from the 19th century. Today, we have offices in 12 locations across Asia Pacific. With our regional headquarters in Hong Kong – a core hub of the worldwide Societe Generale Group – we employ close to 9,000 employees in the region. Our expertise here ranges from corporate and investment banking to asset management, securities services, specialised financial services, trade finance and cash management services. For more information, follow us on Twitter @SocGen_APAC, LinkedIn @Société Générale or visit our website www.societegenerale.asia. As at Feb 2018
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Department Description

Under the responsibility of the Flow Strategy and Solutions team, you will support the Cross-Asset Strategist. During this 12 months, you will assist the Strategist in the development of Flow cross asset derivatives, macro and delta one trade ideas. Further, you will participate in the generation of publication reports and the development of new tools to support the business (Excel / Powerpoint). You will primarily be in charge of generating and maintaining Strategy reports, but will also offer overall assistance to the team (tracking of activity, creating reports). This role will allow you to gain an excellent experience in Market Finance and a valuable knowledge of derivatives product.

Responsibilities
Produce customized Strategy graphs, back-testing and support for Trade Idea generation
Generate and maintain reports
Assist in the production of marketing documents & market color
Contribute to generation of presentation decks
Profile Required

ACADEMIC BACKGROUND AND CERTIFICATIONS, EXPERIENCE
Hold a relevant Bachelors or Masters degree in Finance, Engineering or similar
Solid level in financial mathematics

title: Admin Assistant, Faculty of Art and Design (3 month contract)
company_info: Established in 1938, the Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA) is a pioneer arts institution in Singapore. The Academy is known for its rigorous and high-quality curriculum, innovative and practitioners-led teaching approach, diverse artistic creations and community outreach. NAFA has nurtured 13 recipients of the Cultural Medallion – Singapore’s highest accolade bestowed on art practitioners who have significantly impacted arts and culture. Another 14 alumni have been presented the Young Artist Award. Many of the Academy’s alumni have gone on to make their mark in the professional arts scene in Singapore and abroad. The Academy offers full-time diploma and degree programmes across three schools: the School of Art & Design (fine art, design and media, fashion studies and 3D design), the School of Music and the School of Arts Management, Dance & Theatre. Degree courses are offered in partnership with reputable universities in the United Kingdom. NAFA’s courses are designed and delivered by art educators and practitioners with internationally recognised qualifications. Working with leading industry practitioners, NAFA’s academic schools regularly review and refine their curricula to reflect the changing needs of the industry. Since 1999, NAFA has received polytechnic-level funding from Singapore’s Ministry of Education. In 2011, NAFA became the first comprehensive arts education institution in Singapore to be awarded the four-year EduTrust certificate from the Committee for Private Education. It received its second four-year certification in 2015. NAFA is also the first private arts education institution to launch a government-funded degree programme, namely the Bachelor of Music with Honours degree course in partnership with the Royal College of Music (RCM) in London. The course marks the first time that RCM is conferring its degrees outside the United Kingdom. The learning and research needs of NAFA’s students and faculty are supported by the resources and activities of the Institute of Southeast Asian Arts (ISEAA), the Tanoto Foundation Centre for Southeast Asian Arts and the NAFA Library. Through academic exchanges, seminars and workshops, NAFA maintains a constant dialogue with educators and scholars across the region and beyond. NAFA’s three purpose-built campus buildings are located in Singapore’s Arts & Heritage District, within walking distance to major performing venues, museums and arts groups. The school’s newest addition, the Tower Block at NAFA Campus 1, is an eight-storey extension above the Bencoolen MRT station with new state-of-the-art classrooms, dance and visual arts studios as well as student interaction and self-study areas. With a rich heritage, established track record and an unwavering dedication to the highest standards of arts education, NAFA strives to live up to its mission “to inspire learning and growth through the arts”.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Main Roles and Responsibilities
1. The contact point for lecturers and students for administrative matters and their queries
2. Manage day-to-day operations for the School on:
a. Academic-administrative matters, such as attendance, timetable logistics, engaging visiting lecturers, etc
b. Administrative support on matters relating to course, students’ documents, examinations, lecturers’ monthly claims, procurement, updating of data base and filing, etc
c. Monitoring students’ attendance and academic progression for graduation
3. Liaise with other departments on relevant matters relating to Student Affairs, Estate Management, and Information Technology
4. Assist in organising programme and school events, such as Graduation show, exhibitions, Open House, etc

Requirements
1. Diploma and above in any field with relevant administrative experience, preferably in an education institution
2. Proficient in Microsoft office and fast learner, able to pick up working knowledge of internal IT systems quickly
3. Team player with good interpersonal and communication skills
4. Mature and meticulous with a keen eye for detail

title: Executive / Senior Executive (Partnerships and Development - One year contract, renewable)
company_info: The National University of Singapore aspires to be a vital community of academics, researchers, staff, students and alumni working together in a spirit of innovation and enterprise for a better world. Our singular focus on talent will be the cornerstone of a truly great university that is dedicated to quality education, influential research and visionary enterprise, in service of country and society.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at the NUS Career Portal.

Job Description
The Dean’s Office, Faculty of Science and the Centre for Nature-based Climate Solutions at the National University of Singapore is seeking a highly motivated, passionate individual to join our team. You will be responsible for developing and implementing fundraising strategies and partnerships that will support the Faculty of Science and the Centre for Nature-based Climate Solutions’ research, teaching and outreach programmes. This is an opportunity to become a vital contributor to the NUS ecosystem by playing a critical role in the fundraising and partnership efforts for both new and ongoing projects. You will be part of the Partnerships and Development team that builds relationships to expand the world’s knowledge and lay the scientific groundwork for breakthroughs to make a positive impact on science and climate change goals. The appointment is for an initial period of one year with the possibility of renewal. Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following -
Work closely with the Faculty of Science and the Centre’s leadership team to develop and implement fundraising strategies that align with the Faculty and Centre’s vision and goals.
Support the identification, cultivation, and stewardship of relationships with prospective donors, including individuals, corporations and foundations.
Work with internal stakeholders to develop and articulate gift ideas, donor-centric proposals, decks, and other collateral for various fundraising needs.
Work with internal stakeholders to ensure that the Faculty of Science gift administration is carried out in accordance with NUS policies and procedures.
Actively maintain a database of gift cases, including information on progress, key deliverables, and stewardship requirements.
Manage and steward a portfolio of donors, ensuring timely and accurate reporting and communication.
Assist in developing, organising, and providing logistical support for donor-related and partner-related events.
Develop and manage partnerships with organizations, businesses and other institutions to advance the Centre’s mission and goals.
Perform any other duties as assigned.
Qualifications/Requirements/Other Info
A degree with at least three years of work experience, preferably in a fundraising, research or similar capacity.
Demonstrated experience in fundraising, project management or other relevant areas such as marketing, communications, advertising, public relations, business administration or relationship building roles would be advantageous.
For candidates without non-profit experience, a proven ability to learn new skills and apply them to new environments will be considered.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling proposals and communicate conceptually detailed and complex information in a clear and effective manner.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Highly collaborative, with the ability to work effectively with a wide range of stakeholders.
A self-motivated, enthusiastic team-player.
Passion for science, the environment and education.
- Remuneration is based on a 12-month salary structure, with annual variable bonus which is subject to incumbent’s performance and the University/School’s prevailing remuneration policies.
- The incumbent will be emplaced at an appropriate appointment grade based on his/her individual merits.
- To expedite application processing, a copy of academic certificates and transcripts from GCE O-level onwards should be uploaded via the online application portal.

Application deadline
To apply, please submit your cover letter and resume. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
[Order Number: 2309-2101A]

Position Overview:
As a Supplier Quality Technician you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of materials and components supplied by the vendors. You will work closely with the suppliers to assess, monitor, and improve their quality management processes, contributing to the overall success of the manufacturing operations.

Key Responsibilities:
Conduct quality inspections and audits of incoming materials and components to ensure they meet the specifications and quality standards.
Collaborate with suppliers to address quality issues, provide feedback, and drive continuous improvement.
Perform root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to resolve supplier quality problems.
Maintain accurate records of supplier performance, including quality metrics and non-conformance reports.
Work with cross-functional teams to evaluate and approve new suppliers and components.
Assist in the development and maintenance of quality standards and inspection procedures.
Participate in supplier development initiatives to enhance their capabilities and quality processes.

Qualifications:
Nitec / Diploma or equivalent in Mechanical or Electrical engineering
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in a quality control or supplier quality role within a manufacturing environment.
Strong knowledge of quality management principles, methodologies, and tools (e.g., Six Sigma, Lean, ISO standards).
Proficient in reading engineering drawings and specifications.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to conduct root cause analysis.
Effective communication skills to collaborate with suppliers and internal teams.
Detail-oriented with a strong focus on accuracy and documentation.
Ability to travel occasionally to Malaysia’s facilities as needed.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
QA Objectives:
Propose a service quality plan which will detail the quality assurance measures, the method of accountability, the performance indicators, quality management
oversight, contractual requirements, timeline, and ways to evaluate the effectiveness of the plan to the Authority for endorsement before the commencement date of the Contract.
Inculcate service quality mindset amongst the Customer Service Officers (CSO)
Incorporate the survey script and conduct customer satisfaction survey for each call CSO received for customer service satisfaction audit purposes.
Review the survey results of the customer satisfaction survey and implement improvement measures/plans.
Coach CSOs on the service quality standards (e.g.,1-to-1 training).
Conduct monthly or ad-hoc internal audits each month to ensure continual demonstration of the satisfactory service quality by the CSOs, including adherence to the Public Service’s No Wrong Door policy, First Responder Protocol, the Authority’s Service Standards and KPI Standards.
Job Responsibilities:
Perform transaction monitoring audits in accordance with the Authority’s agreed Marking Guidelines.
Highlight and coach/arrange coaching the identified outliers on the respective non-compliance.
To prepare and broadcast innovative quality initiatives like infographics.
Execute investigations and provided findings as well as corrective actions in the event non-conformities are identified.
Work with Contact Centre Manager (CCM), Trainer and Team Leaders on quality initiatives and facilitate reward programs.
Perform Post Call Survey Validation and call out to lowly rated surveys to understand reason for failure.
Validate Compliments and compile types of errors, service lapses/complaints and submit via Feedback Tracker to client weekly.
Analyzes the raw data and identifies areas that require attention such as high occurrence of the same error and reoccurrence of error by same CSO.
Highlight any concerns to CCM, Trainer and Team Leaders for discussion after coaching sessions.
Providing inputs and ensuring that the required QA reports are completed in a timely manner for provision to client.
To cover Trainer’s job duties during Trainer’s absence.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.

Understanding of agile/scrum methodology

title: Fleet Engineering Specialist (Mechanical | Electrical) - 2 Year Contract
company_info: We are PSA Marine, a leader in the maritime sector since 1964. From our early days as the Port of Singapore Authority to corporatisation as PSA Marine, we have played a vital role in Singapore’s growth as the world’s busiest container transhipment hub. Over the years, our business portfolio has expanded beyond core businesses – Towage and Pilotage, to marine advisory, ship-to-ship transfer, navigational audit, water supply by waterboat, crew transfer in the offshore wind industry, and training and consultancy services. With our team of 1,800 dedicated employees and modern fleet of more than 70 tugs, we have a presence in Peru, Europe, Bangladesh, China (including Hong Kong and Taiwan), India, Oman, and Southeast Asia today. We are committed to deliver only the best as we continue to be alongside our customers and stakeholders in every leg of their journey. Our commitment to excellence fuels our zeal to innovate and define the future of maritime for the generations ahead.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
[This is a 2-year contract position, with the option to convert to a full-time permanent position, subject to work performance and attitude.]

(Mechanical) Candidates are expected to:-
Carry out repair, maintenance, and troubleshooting of machinery onboard PSA Marine harbour crafts
Liaise with Fleet Operations team on breakdown reports and harbour crafts status
Perform lathe machining, basic gas welding, and cutting works to facilitate repair to machinery
Assist in lifting activities, forklift operation, confined space assessment
Perform proper disposal of used oils and chemicals
(Electrical) Candidates are expected to:-
Carry out repair, maintenance and troubleshooting of machinery onboard PSA Marine harbour crafts
Liaise with Fleet Operations team on breakdown reports and harbour crafts status
Troubleshoot and carry out thorough rectification of deficiencies in machinery and control system
Perform wiring and connection of electrical cables
Install electrical and electronic accessories and components
The ideal candidate should preferably:-
Possess at least a Nitec in Marine Technology, Electrical Engineering, or Mechanical Engineering
Be proficient in Microsoft Office applications
Possess a valid Class 3 driving license and MOM accredited certifications such as SSIC, Safety Supervisor, Lifting Supervisor, Forklift Driving
For Mechanical candidates: Prior experience in performing mechanical fitment, basic gas and TIG welding, hydraulic and pneumatic system troubleshooting will be considered favourably
For Electrical candidates: Good knowledge of electrical and instrument systems and familiar with electrical schematics diagrams and symbols will be considered favourably
Candidates with relevant experience may be considered for a senior position
*New hires may be eligible for a sign-on bonus of up to S$3,000. Terms and conditions apply.

title: Associate Specialist, Quality Control (WDA) - 2 Years Contract
company_info: MSD is a global healthcare leader working to help the world be well. MSD is a tradename of Merck & Co., Inc., with headquarters in Whitehouse Station, N.J., U.S.A. Through our prescription medicines, vaccines, biologic therapies, and consumer care and animal health products, we work with customers and operate in more than 140 countries to deliver innovative health solutions. We also demonstrate our commitment to increasing access to healthcare through far-reaching policies, programs and partnerships.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reporting to Lab Manager, Quality Control, the Chemist is responsible for performing and reviewing laboratory testing of intermediates, final products and stability batches in Laboratories.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Critical responsibilities but not limited to:
Ensure tests and other tasks assigned are performed in a timely manner in compliance to Standard Operating procedures, requirements specified in our company Quality and Safety Standards, regulatory dossiers and pharmacopoeia.
Manage and perform calibration, maintenance and qualification of laboratory equipment.
Participate in laboratory efficiency improvement tasks, analytical method transfer, development, validation and equipment qualifications activities.
Conduct and support Laboratory investigation on laboratory equipment failure, OOT and OOS and identify the root cause and its report writing.
Review and revise Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and laboratory test methods.
Perform and maintain good laboratory housekeeping (5S), inventory and in-house stock control, reference standards, chemical reagents, and consumables.
After one year on the position, you will be competent to perform most of the laboratory testing following cGMP, data integrity and GLP requirement. You will be trained to use various laboratory equipment ranging from such as particle size analyzer, FTIR, UV-Vis spectrometer, microscope, Empower CDS, HPLC, etc.

WHAT YOU MUST HAVE
Bachelor Degree in Chemistry / Biochemistry with prior working experience preferred.
Minimum 2 years’ experience in lab testing and chemical analysis is preferred
Experience in particle size analyser, HPLC, FTIR, Karl Fischer Titrator with technical competency is preferred.
Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of cGMP, GLP, and associated regulatory expectations related to Analytical testing is preferred
This is a career conversion programme under Workforce Singapore (WSG) and candidates must meet the following criteria and are open to the following conditions:
Singaporeans/Singapore PRs only
PMETs/Mid-Careerist with no prior work experience in Biopharma industry are welcomed to apply
Open to two years contract
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT
Limitless opportunities across various areas in Manufacturing; well-structured career path
A state-of-the-art facility that delivers solution to its customers world-wide

In Singapore, Manpower works with hundreds of local SMEs and multinational companies across various industries, including : Banking and Finance Corporate Finance and Accounting Call Center Engineering Events and Exhibitions Healthcare Hospitality Information Technology Life Sciences Logistics and Supply Chain Oil and Gas Retail See what is humanly possible at manpower.com.sg. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Operation Support Specialist (Planning/ cGMP/ Contract/ Tuas)

Duration: 12 months
Location: Tuas
Salary : Up to $5600 depending on experience
Non-Shift

Responsibilities
Manufacturing Excellence Supply & Cost
Supports the plan, schedule and coordination of maintenance activities with maintenance team and IPT planner with support from other engineers and Senior Manager. Supports activities that interfere with production in order to reduce downtime.
Serve as landlord for facility with support from other engineers and Senior Manager. Works with operations staff and maintenance team to correct deficiencies in housekeeping, maintenance, and facility-related procedures.
Generates/support qualification and functional verification document for commissioning.
Participate/Supports equipment commissioning, including FAT / SAT.
Supports plant modification proposals and track changes to completion.
Supports generation of cleaning batch sheets for product change-over and new equipment.
Participate in cleaning development and cleaning validation activities
Will support PTO in technology transfers for new product introductions into the plant.

Trainings:
Carry out training on new operations SOPs and on-the-job training for technicians, including cGMP, SOPs and safety procedures as needed.
Works closely with the learning specialist to develop the training packages including the competency-based framework for any new or revised SOP.

Quality / SHE Stewardship Quality Compliance:
Participate in Proactive Process Analysis (PPA).
Demonstrates ability to lead/support investigations associated with equipment, facilities, and people with support from other engineers and Senior Manager
Conduct periodic review of equipment qualification, SOPs, preventive maintenance activities and calibrations.
Able to support internal, external and corporate QA audits and follow-up on corrective actions and preventive actions.
Generate SOP’s for plant operation in accordance with cGMP and conduct training.
Able to write technical documents for investigations and audit responses.

Safety:
Demonstrates and promotes a safe and injury free work culture and engages employees at all levels on SHE issues.
Participate in internal, external and Corporate Safety and Environmental audits and follow-up on corrective actions and Preventive actions.

People excellence:
Serve as point of contact in all aspect of production activities and technical support of all production equipment and facilities.
Participate in MPS related activities to instill continuous improvement mindset in the operation team.
Carry out specific administrative tasks as instructed by the Senior Manager, Operations.
Any other duties as and when assigned by the Manager.


Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in chemical engineering or science related fields
2-4 years of experience in operations specialist within cGMP environment
Experience in process technical
Good organization & coordination skills
Good inter-personal skills and communication skills

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is a well-established MNC, market leader in the Water Treatment industry. They are looking for a Process Engineer assist their Engineering team for the next phrase of their business. They are located in South – easily accessible.

Responsibilities:
Reviewing system specifications related to De Nora Supplied equipment and ensuring that the process design aligns with the performance guarantee outlined in the contract.
Preparing essential process documentation, including P&ID (Piping and Instrumentation Diagram), PFD (Process Flow Diagram), Mass balance, hydraulic calculations, pressure drop calculations, intelligent P&ID, etc.
Conducting sizing and detailed calculations for critical equipment such as tanks, pumps, control valves, and other equipment within our proprietary boundaries, ensuring justifications are sound.
Developing comprehensive function write-ups, cause and effect analyses, and control philosophies.
Participating in technical review meetings with clients and addressing any process-related inquiries and comments effectively.
Collaborating on HAZOP (Hazard and Operability) studies and addressing relevant comments.
Providing support in the preparation of Instruction & Operation Manuals.
Preparing commissioning procedures and actively supporting commissioning activities on-site.
Assisting in the process review of proposals during bid preparation.
Collaborating and coordinating with other engineering disciplines, the Project Manager, and the Client to ensure seamless project execution.

Requirements:
Bachelors in engineering (Chemical or Environmental) with 5 years prior experience
5 years’ experience in water and wastewater treatment process design

company_info: APBA TG Human Resource Pte Ltd (a wholly owned subsidiary of the TG Group) TG Group (“TG”) is a global workforce solutions provider with an international reach in over 50 markets across the globe. TG adopts a future-centric approach where we aspire to be at the forefront of the evolution of the future of work. We believe that human capital is the greatest asset to any institution. With a wealth of experience in the Human Resources (HR) industry, we combine our international expertise and local know-how to deliver bespoke and innovative workforce solutions.
